Removing TODO (to be tracked in Bandit wiki)

This change removes the TODO file from the Bandit source tree.  We'll keep
track of these on the Bandit wiki page for now, and - assuming the project
continues to grow - eventually move to the OpenStack tracker:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Projects/Bandit#TODO

commit_message:
Enable physical external interface

When the OVS bridge is created it can (successfully) attach to an
interface that has not been enabled.  This patch uses 'route' to
enable the interface specified in the environment.

Fixed indentation
Added Unit Test

Change-Id: I8456a5cd9c0ec2fe9f6b890808c030898197042b

commit_message:
Shorten long lines in devref docs.

There was quite a few very long and sometimes even extremely long lines in Nova
devref docs files. That made reading the docs files difficult.
Also making the lines shorter than 80 characters long make these files
compliant with widely use coding standard.

Change-Id: I7ea80d7de84517cb3a791f39609334ffdb33b1c4

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-27 14:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/designer.py'], 'message': 'Adds libvirt "script path" in domain.xml

Sometimes one could want to override the default vif-scripts specified by
libvirt during domain creation. Example:
...
    <interface type="bridge">
      <mac address="fa:16:3e:9a:03:e8"/>
      <model type="netfront"/>
      <source bridge="brq86f7bdc4-6a"/>
      <script path="/etc/xen/scripts/vif-openstack"/>
      <target dev="tap8f0727fb-d2"/>
    </interface>
...
The patch introduces a new config option called "libvirt_vif_script" for
nova.conf.
Default is set to None. If the option is not specified the behaviour of
compute/libvirt is unaltered. If specified it configures "script path" in
domain.xml. Kindly notice example above.

Change-Id: If8565fc5e375eb1b061ff703aa01a6b483e97ee6
Closes-Bug: 1186964
'}]
commit_message:
Adds libvirt "script path" in domain.xml

Sometimes one could want to override the default vif-scripts specified by
libvirt during domain creation. Example:
...
    <interface type="bridge">
      <mac address="fa:16:3e:9a:03:e8"/>
      <model type="netfront"/>
      <source bridge="brq86f7bdc4-6a"/>
      <script path="/etc/xen/scripts/vif-openstack"/>
      <target dev="tap8f0727fb-d2"/>
    </interface>
...
The patch introduces a new config option called "libvirt_vif_script" for
nova.conf.
Default is set to None. If the option is not specified the behaviour of
compute/libvirt is unaltered. If specified it configures "script path" in
domain.xml. Kindly notice example above.

Change-Id: If8565fc5e375eb1b061ff703aa01a6b483e97ee6
Closes-Bug: 1186964

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-12 10:43:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resources/__init__.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/availability_zone_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/consumers/availability_zone.py', 'nova/compute/resources/base.py', 'nova/compute/resources/availability_zone.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'setup.cfg', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Isolate availability_zone API from Scheduler

As part of blueprint isolate-scheduler-db , we need to change how
filters get/check if host passes or not by only looking at HostState. Here, we
change how availability_zone_filter is checking which aggregates
the host belong to, by updating HostState thanks to ResourceTracker instead of
calling aggregate API from the filters.

the change can be divided in two parts:
- Use the ResourceTracker plugin to provide aggregates info the host
  belongs to as a JSON in stats.
- Call update_available_resource im add/remove_aggregate_host() to
  update the host state if host is added or removed from an aggregate.

Implements blueprint isolate-scheduler-db

Change-Id: I8138b94ea8ebb8fc567c62efc21b5ddae8b6f8b2
'}]
commit_message:
Isolate availability_zone API from Scheduler

As part of blueprint isolate-scheduler-db , we need to change how
filters get/check if host passes or not by only looking at HostState. Here, we
change how availability_zone_filter is checking which aggregates
the host belong to, by updating HostState thanks to ResourceTracker instead of
calling aggregate API from the filters.

the change can be divided in two parts:
- Use the ResourceTracker plugin to provide aggregates info the host
  belongs to as a JSON in stats.
- Call update_available_resource im add/remove_aggregate_host() to
  update the host state if host is added or removed from an aggregate.

Implements blueprint isolate-scheduler-db

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8138b94ea8ebb8fc567c62efc21b5ddae8b6f8b2

[WIP] Move the policy checks into REST API layer for shelve v3 extension

This patch move the policy checks into REST API layer for shelve
extension. And keep the same behavior for V2 API.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

commit_message:
Add 'usage' param to `quotas-show` resource

Although Nova checks resource usages while setting quotas,
it is also useful to be able to retrive usage information along
with current quota values. This implementation mimics the way Cinder
allows users to see resources' usage information via 'os-quota-sets' plugin.

Implements: blueprint usage-stats-in-quota-show

Change-Id: I1f495c0e0e9f86cdaf45f7d7a743cbb07c61477b

commit_message:
Change logging level AUDIT to INFO

According to the latest revision of the logging guidelines message
of type AUDIT should be moved to INFO. Also added the log translations hints.

The latest revision is available at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91446/
at the moment.

Change-Id: Id381abda5b6acf80add7191fde4c65ec9dceba9d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-18 15:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/consoleauth/rpcapi.py', 'nova/objects/console_auth_token.py', 'nova/conductor/api.py', 'nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/234_create_console_auth_tokens.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Allow running multiple consoleauth services

Make sure that multiple consoleauth processes can run in the
same environment without external memcache. The main problem
with that setup was about tokens not being available to other
services at the same time. (they were cached only in one daemon)
As a side-effect the change also allows restarting consoleauth
processes without losing tokens permanently.

External interfaces and behaviours do not change. Tokens will be
written to the database as well as the usual cache. If the cache
does not hold the token, the database will be checked.

All database operations happen via the conductor interface.

Depending on the number of requests for tokens in the environment
it may be necessary to cleanup the console_auth_tokens table from
time to time.

Closes-bug: 1243306
DocImpact

Change-Id: I33d3ff165ae67185839a7cee130fab4e411510db
'}]
commit_message:
Allow running multiple consoleauth services

Make sure that multiple consoleauth processes can run in the
same environment without external memcache. The main problem
with that setup was about tokens not being available to other
services at the same time. (they were cached only in one daemon)
As a side-effect the change also allows restarting consoleauth
processes without losing tokens permanently.

External interfaces and behaviours do not change. Tokens will be
written to the database as well as the usual cache. If the cache
does not hold the token, the database will be checked.

All database operations happen via the conductor interface.

Depending on the number of requests for tokens in the environment
it may be necessary to cleanup the console_auth_tokens table from
time to time.

Closes-bug: 1243306
DocImpact

Change-Id: I33d3ff165ae67185839a7cee130fab4e411510db

commit_message:
doc: automatically generate the vm states graph

This commit adds a hook in the build system that parses the nova/compute code
and generates the graph in doc/source/devref/vmstates.rst. This makes sure this
graph stays up-to-date.

Change-Id: I64355f81417fb0bcd41fee27f76f23f0d876461d
Implements: blueprint generate-vmstates-graph

Currently glance_api_servers option doesn't respect glance_protocol
setting, and the only way to configure SSL enabled glance api servers is
to prefix 'https://' for each api server, which may cause inconsistency
and confusion.

This change take glance_protocol option as default glance_api_servers

commit_message:
Use glance_protocol as default glance_api_servers protocol

Currently glance_api_servers option doesn't respect glance_protocol
setting, and the only way to configure SSL enabled glance api servers is
to prefix 'https://' for each api server, which may cause inconsistency
and confusion.

This change take glance_protocol option as default glance_api_servers
protol prefix if not set. Glance api server settings with explicit
protocol specified are still respected.

Change-Id: I24fde2191b24f4a5af7803eb656062bd4843ef67
Closes-bug: 1322438

commit_message:
Rename EC2-specific exception for clarity

A user of the EC2 API can provide an invalid volume ID and will
be told that they have provided an invalid instance ID which
should be of format i-...

This is due to the ambiguous exception used to validate EC2 IDs
with the EC2 API.  This patch addresses this problem by renaming
the InvalidInstanceIDMalformed exception to InvalidEc2IDMalformed.

Change-Id: I98313f918818db2313d6908b8b47ce62ded8a34f
Closes-Bug: #1199308

commit_message:
Update nova.api with new log transation guidelines

During the Icehouse release cycle, new log translation guidelines
were put in place to make translating easier for deployers.

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

This patch updates the nova.api module with the new guideline
which uses new function for log annotation which are _LI, _LW,
_LE and _LC for info, warning, error and critical messages
respectively, allowing translators to prioritize their work
on the type of messages that their deployers need.

Change-Id: I678aae624f178e14a74ac021428d51ad7068b3ce

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-02 15:39:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Refresh instance nw_info cache on vif plugged

Ensure the network info in the instance cache are update when
network-vif-plugged or network-vif-unplugged events are
received from Neutron.

This will ensure the instance cache is updated with the actual
state of the VIF; otherwise instances might end up failing to
become active after events such as a rebuild, because the spawn
operation would be waiting for an event which was actually
already received and handled.

It is worth noting that refreshing the instance's network info
cache on network-info-unplugged was not needed to fix this bug.
Nevertheless, this patch does reload the cache on this event too
in order to avoid a similar bug will manifest in the future.

Closes-bug: 1329546

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh instance nw_info cache on vif plugged

Ensure the network info in the instance cache are update when
network-vif-plugged or network-vif-unplugged events are
received from Neutron.

This will ensure the instance cache is updated with the actual
state of the VIF; otherwise instances might end up failing to
become active after events such as a rebuild, because the spawn
operation would be waiting for an event which was actually
already received and handled.

It is worth noting that refreshing the instance's network info
cache on network-info-unplugged was not needed to fix this bug.
Nevertheless, this patch does reload the cache on this event too
in order to avoid a similar bug will manifest in the future.

Closes-bug: 1329546

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb

When we set inject_partition = -1 and inject_password = True in
nova.conf, nova boot will sucessfully inject password but there are
errors in log when nova try to resize2fs the image.
To fix this issue, we need to pass partition parameter when
instantiate VFS in is_image_partitionless function.

Change-Id: I1c203049927e401c55335a754381311d00b7e073
Closes-bug: #1352806
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mounting error issue in is_image_partitionless when nova booting

When we set inject_partition = -1 and inject_password = True in
nova.conf, nova boot will sucessfully inject password but there are
errors in log when nova try to resize2fs the image.
To fix this issue, we need to pass partition parameter when
instantiate VFS in is_image_partitionless function.

Change-Id: I1c203049927e401c55335a754381311d00b7e073
Closes-bug: #1352806

commit_message:
xenapi: fix up volume_utils used by attach_volume

Currently the calls from volumeops into volume_utils, and between all
the volume utils in attach_volume, are very confusing.

This starts to get a better split between volumeops and volume_utils
around the attach volume code.

Change-Id: Id957de3c726ac32764510fff6e603f6c234639b0

commit_message:
Prevent using port and network id together

Currently user can specify port id and network id together for creating
new instance. However similar pair of parameters gives BadRequest answer
during attaching new interface. This patch makes behaviour more
consistent.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Idc51cf3a8d81f1c64196e792d7d0d6cde16e4265
Closes-Bug: #1282582

commit_message:
Add user_id and project_id to extra_md

It is typically useful for users of openstack
to be able to use the project_id and user_id from
inside cloud-init (for example to install applications
automatically for a given project_id). This change
introduces this concept to the openstack metadata which
is exposed via the openstack metadata service and the
config-drive (but does not expose it to the ec2 metadata
service since no such concept is valid there).

Change-Id: I8ffb0c276f7000c1c5372aa7bc87d912f93a6c54

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8163, 'name': 'Sreeram Yerrapragada', 'email': 'syerrapragada@vmware.com', 'username': 'syerrapragada'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10504, 'name': 'lirenke', 'email': 'lvhancy@163.com', 'username': 'Lirenke'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Call instance_claim() when doing live migration

When doing a live migration currently the resources required by the instance
are not immediately accounted for in the resource tracking for that compute
node.  Instead, we rely on the periodic audit to detect the increased
resource usage.  Using the defaults this means that it could take up to a
minute before the increase usage is reflected in the database.

This commit will account for the resources immediately in order to reduce
races in the scheduler.  It's not ideal since normally we'd want to use a
"with" clause on the claim object, but since this code is running on the
target while the main migration is driven from the source that would be
a bit tricky.

There's currently a flaw in the rollback code, it isn't called for shared
storage so cleanup will only be done by the audit in that case.  Bug
1284719 is tracking this issue.

Change-Id: I5ca5e5d2849481e8c0d461637891c95459e02ec3
Closes-Bug: 1289064
'}]
commit_message:
Call instance_claim() when doing live migration

When doing a live migration currently the resources required by the instance
are not immediately accounted for in the resource tracking for that compute
node.  Instead, we rely on the periodic audit to detect the increased
resource usage.  Using the defaults this means that it could take up to a
minute before the increase usage is reflected in the database.

This commit will account for the resources immediately in order to reduce
races in the scheduler.  It's not ideal since normally we'd want to use a
"with" clause on the claim object, but since this code is running on the
target while the main migration is driven from the source that would be
a bit tricky.

There's currently a flaw in the rollback code, it isn't called for shared
storage so cleanup will only be done by the audit in that case.  Bug
1284719 is tracking this issue.

Change-Id: I5ca5e5d2849481e8c0d461637891c95459e02ec3
Closes-Bug: 1289064

commit_message:
Support disable_terminate for instance

With 'disable_terminate' option, we can protect instance from being
accidentally terminated. When instance's disable_terminate is true,
instance does not allow to delete. Now nova api does not support it.

Change-Id: I8c833fbb797c9dfb4e5c52e863c42015fe78c6f3
Closes-Bug: #1346829

commit_message:
Change log format from '%' to ','

In compute manager ,there are some logs used '%', The difference
between '%' and ',' are % will be executed whatever the log level it
is while ',' will not. So this patch changes in nova/compute/manage.py,
additional patches will be submitted by adding hacking rule.

Change-Id: I0b37c465edc346be4245001cfbded5f7ed05541d

commit_message:
Use oslo.vmware image_transfer for image download

Switch to use the oslo.vmware library to download flat or
sparse disk images.

This integer configuration option image_transfer_timeout_secs
configures the maximum amount of time to wait for image tranfers
to complete when the driver switches to use oslo.vmware for image
transfers.

DocImpact - new option image_transfer_timeout_secs to configure timeout
            on image transfers
Implements: blueprint vmware-vsan-support
Change-Id: I0ed77b28dd91a6436093b1799fd1ddf57f99a884

commit_message:
Make the MAX_CONSOLE_BYTES configurable

DocImpact: ideally, we would like to display the full console log for users to
diagnosis the problems. But now, the MAX_CONSOLE_BYTES is fixed to
100KB, sometimes it's not big enough, so it's better to enable
configure it.

Change-Id: I26ded77f0621ca244a0fc86cd17460e45089db7c
Closes-Bug: #1341363

Adding 10 new configuration switches that would enable
cache scrubbing for images that were deleted from
glance but still present on local disks.

* purge_deleted_images: Bool
  When set to true, will call the CacheScrubber class
  Default: False
* glance_os_username: String
* glance_os_password: String
* glance_os_tenant_id: String
* glance_os_tenant_name: String

* os_auth_url: String

commit_message:
Adding a cache scrubber in ImageCacheManager

Adding 10 new configuration switches that would enable
cache scrubbing for images that were deleted from
glance but still present on local disks.

* purge_deleted_images: Bool
  When set to true, will call the CacheScrubber class
  Default: False
* glance_os_username: String
* glance_os_password: String
* glance_os_tenant_id: String
* glance_os_tenant_name: String
* os_cacert: String
* os_auth_url: String
* os_region_name: String
* os_endpoint_type: String
* insecure: Bool
  Default: False

This patch also make the code in imagecache.py and
cachescrubber.py pass the pep8/flake8 validations.

DocImpact
Blueprint: nova-compute-base-cleanup

Change-Id: Icd00854c6a071b166e2ef1ccd150377055a5eaed

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load instead of load.

yaml.load will execute arbitrary code.

Also use context managers to ensure files are closed

Change-Id: I704baa7916ee834c12821009d8e3029b1b8fa340

commit_message:
Improve readability of HACKING doc

To keep readers from assuming step 3 is an incomplete sentence,
this patch changes the text from "Read on" to "See specific
guidelines below".  See comments[1] for more info.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/133258/3/HACKING.rst

Change-Id: I6f674c8661485994496f492c82152c7d0aba8ae7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-02 13:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Throw error if a non-existent cloud is requested

The error messages when a bogus cloud is requested are very confusing.

Change-Id: Idf68d1db7e5fccd712283775eb4d636d78ae5fc7
'}]
commit_message:
Throw error if a non-existent cloud is requested

The error messages when a bogus cloud is requested are very confusing.
(They'll be things like "no auth url provided") Instead, be explicit
on the problem.

Change-Id: Idf68d1db7e5fccd712283775eb4d636d78ae5fc7

commit_message:
Revert "Switch Cinder to use oslo.concurrency"

This reverts commit 372df8a75b33d23a42a8e636090c91668a56a586.

This commit removed two options that should have been deprecated
disable_process_locking and lock_path.

Change-Id: Iabdc09e9f3335181a97a85abc832f63625b7ccfe
Closes-Bug: #1394963

commit_message:
Make some v3 auth data default to the keystone default domain

For a better user experience, we should probably default the
user_domain (name and id) and the project_domain (name and id)
to the default domain.

Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I40c5bc206a1405b4b79d73248758341e4fe85363

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 15:37:34.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/orchestrator_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': "Check nodes availability using mcollective

If we talk about provisioning operation,
first mcollective operation will be 'erase_node'
from mcollective 'erase_node' agent.

We just need stop deployment if any of nodes
got problem with erasing.

This fix help to detect problem with bootstrap
image as early as possible.

Change-Id: I3047f7cc097eda5e63099f0299f7696c15fba10f

(cherry picked from commit 84cca6c1789552df6d9a775faad026ad85abe8d5)

commit_message:
Check nodes availability using mcollective

If we talk about provisioning operation,
first mcollective operation will be 'erase_node'
from mcollective 'erase_node' agent.

We just need stop deployment if any of nodes
got problem with erasing.

This fix help to detect problem with bootstrap
image as early as possible.

Change-Id: I3047f7cc097eda5e63099f0299f7696c15fba10f
Closes-Bug: #1373988
(cherry picked from commit 84cca6c1789552df6d9a775faad026ad85abe8d5)

commit_message:
Improve tests exceptions handling

If test fails and then creation of diagnostic
snapshot using nailgun also fails, try to get
logs stored on master node via SSH.

Change-Id: I5456616cf7088210860a4d4a786531333070f3e5
Closes-bug: #1389287

This problem was introduced by
635581e9c7aee75ab64dd51c5d4eb5c759c1d2d4.  This class still assumed
its base class used RpcProxy.  It now needs to use the proper
oslo.messaging APIs.

Partial-bug: #1394848

commit_message:
Don't assume RpcProxy base in FWaasL3PluginApi

This problem was introduced by
635581e9c7aee75ab64dd51c5d4eb5c759c1d2d4.  This class still assumed
its base class used RpcProxy.  It now needs to use the proper
oslo.messaging APIs.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I8c0b029b570dad19d4e4231a1ba2bff38b510e6b
Partial-bug: #1394848

check-tempest-dsvm-docker is running as a silent
non-voting job for a while now. Let us promote this
job to the check queue instead as Nova trunk changes
have been breaking the docker driver code and this
will enable us to spot problems quickly. We are still
running this as a non-voting job.

Example of Nova trunk changes breaking the driver:

commit_message:
Switch dsvm-docker as a Nova check jobs

check-tempest-dsvm-docker is running as a silent
non-voting job for a while now. Let us promote this
job to the check queue instead as Nova trunk changes
have been breaking the docker driver code and this
will enable us to spot problems quickly. We are still
running this as a non-voting job.

Example of Nova trunk changes breaking the driver:
I06a2d02e65cd3eb0813caf3972013500d94d493c

Change-Id: I374feb538eb30a56b9d030545a7f4223d677e760

subject: Adds support for Functional Nova-Network
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 10419, 'name': 'Ryan Hallisey', 'email': 'rhallise@redhat.com', 'username': 'rhallisey'}, {'_account_id': 11822, 'name': 'Toshiaki Higuchi', 'email': 'tos-higuchi@sx.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'higuchimxj'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 17:49:29.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova-compute/nova-network/Dockerfile', 'tools/start-all-pods', 'docker/nova-compute/nova-network/start.sh', 'k8s/pod/nova-compute-pod.yaml', 'docker/nova-base/config-nova.sh', 'docker/nova-compute/nova-network/config-nova-network.sh'], 'message': "Adds support for Functional Nova-Network

Previously, the nova-network service was not fully functional.
This patch adds multi-interface support to the nova-network
container. The eth0 configuration is moved to a bridge (br100 per
nova defaults), and configures eth0 and eth1 as bridged
interfaces. eth0 is used for the nova-flat network and eth1 for
foating-ip's. This model is identical to typical bare-metal
nova-network deployments. The patch depends on the following patch
to kube-heat template that provides multiple interfaces per minion:

https://github.com/larsks/heat-kubernetes/pull/8

Rebased. Fixed merge conflict with k8s/pod/nova-compute-pod.yaml

Change-Id: Ieb59f397981a226555ce55ca621ef578b987e3c6
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for Functional Nova-Network

Previously, the nova-network service was not fully functional.
This patch adds multi-interface support to the nova-network
container. The eth0 configuration is moved to a bridge (br100 per
nova defaults), and configures eth0 and eth1 as bridged
interfaces. eth0 is used for the nova-flat network and eth1 for
foating-ip's. This model is identical to typical bare-metal
nova-network deployments. The patch depends on the following patch
to kube-heat template that provides multiple interfaces per minion:

https://github.com/larsks/heat-kubernetes/pull/8

Rebased. Fixed merge conflict with k8s/pod/nova-compute-pod.yaml

Change-Id: Ieb59f397981a226555ce55ca621ef578b987e3c6

commit_message:
Implement zaqar container

The current implementation has been configured to use sqlite instead of
mongodb, since that container service is not yet available. Also, there
are no Icehouse RPMs available, so the Juno RPMs are fetched and
manually installed.

Implements: blueprint kube-zaqar-container

Change-Id: Ie875ab43ad3db92ae2712492ee151fbad0fec3cc

commit_message:
Stash Apache httpd logs

When Keystone is running under Apache httpd, the logs are stored
in httpd's log location. All the logs, including Keystone's, should
be stashed during cleanup.

Change-Id: Ib4f385981e7b24bf9fe8d513f8bedcccec0eefc3
Related-Bug: #1359995

commit_message:
Create example generator

This code adds a feature to the tests where all of the example
snippets are generated and then validated. Tests fail if the new
examples don't match the old ones, meaning a dev changing the API
must update the snippets, triggering a conversation about the changes
during the pull request.

Implements: blueprint example-snippet-generator
Change-Id: I5f1bfd47558a646a56e519614ae76a55759a4422

The VMAX FC driver didn't use the look up service for auto zoning.
Instead it built initiator target map itself. However, that
requires the initiator to log into the fabric before zoning
in order to find out target WWNs.

This patch is to use the look up service to find out valid initiator
target WWNS and use that to build initiator target map. With this fix,
the initiator is no longer required to log into the fabric ahead of time.

Closes-Bug: #1379156

Change-Id: I76e1a8a2e7d4230b851b763f7d13dd1489b69364
"}]
commit_message:
Use look up service for auto zoning

The VMAX FC driver didn't use the look up service for auto zoning.
Instead it built initiator target map itself. However, that
requires the initiator to log into the fabric before zoning
in order to find out target WWNs.

This patch is to use the look up service to find out valid initiator
target WWNS and use that to build initiator target map. With this fix,
the initiator is no longer required to log into the fabric ahead of time.

Closes-Bug: #1379156
(cherry picked from commit 8707458a98bd1e4059939325659a7290757d972f)
Change-Id: I76e1a8a2e7d4230b851b763f7d13dd1489b69364

subject: Set libvirt.live_migration_uri to use ssh
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 19:21:43.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt'], 'message': 'Set libvirt.live_migration_uri to use ssh

While the recommended production value is qemu+tls this requires a CA
and x509 certs. For multi node devstack testing we already set up ssh
keys so just use those.  While TLS is recommended SSH is also a valid
deployment option.

There is a parallel nova patch that is sorting out what the best default
value should be in nova: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136080

Change-Id: I950b1eefe288adbeac843d3dcac553eacc7181de
'}]
commit_message:
Set libvirt.live_migration_uri to use ssh

While the recommended production value is qemu+tls this requires a CA
and x509 certs. For multi node devstack testing we already set up ssh
keys so just use those.  While TLS is recommended SSH is also a valid
deployment option.

There is a parallel nova patch that is sorting out what the best default
value should be in nova: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136080

Change-Id: I950b1eefe288adbeac843d3dcac553eacc7181de

commit_message:
Split API and RPC workers in to one separate process each (WIP)

I'm putting this patch up to test separating API and RPC.  We already
know that running 4 api servers has not yet worked in the Jenkins
review jobs from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59787.  This is an
experiment to see whether running one of each will pass.

Change-Id: If85c88fce0607296f5b90c00386761aa6367018b

subject: Sample thin interface
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-13 14:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['examples/thin.py', 'openstack/network/v2/thin.py'], 'message': "Sample thin interface

Here is an example of a thin interface for the SDK.  We aren't
making any resources here, it is all dictionaries.  Assuming we
have a session:

    from openstack.network.v2 import thin
    requests = thin.Thin()
    for dictobj in requests.list_networks(session):
        print(dictobj['id'])

Obviously, the thin layer isn't doing much, but it does provide
a simple interface to access the methods.  There may be cases
when it would need to do more.

If we go with this approach, we'd just neeed to be sure that if
a resource needed special handling for an operation, we override
the class method rather than the object method.

Change-Id: I2b41ad64348802f6461abfd39a157e808686bb4d
"}]
commit_message:
Sample thin interface

Here is an example of a thin interface for the SDK.  We aren't
making any resources here, it is all dictionaries.  Assuming we
have a session:

    from openstack.network.v2 import thin
    requests = thin.Thin()
    for dictobj in requests.list_networks(session):
        print(dictobj['id'])

Obviously, the thin layer isn't doing much, but it does provide
a simple interface to access the methods.  There may be cases
when it would need to do more.

If we go with this approach, we'd just neeed to be sure that if
a resource needed special handling for an operation, we override
the class method rather than the object method.

Change-Id: I2b41ad64348802f6461abfd39a157e808686bb4d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-13 17:34:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/network/v2/floatingip.py', 'openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Implement iterator paging

Instead of manually passing in limit and marker, automatically set the
marker to the end of the received data and continue requesting data
until none is returned. This is a naive implementation as it doesn't
attempt to know when it has received all of the data without making one
request past the end, as pagination is implemented in several different
ways across the services. Optimizations to reduce that extra call should
probably be implemented per-service due to those differences.

Change-Id: I63a8eb7836c1a614e4bc2ee98fa93f239b343cbb
"}]
commit_message:
Implement iterator paging

Instead of manually passing in limit and marker, automatically set the
marker to the end of the received data and continue requesting data
until none is returned. This is a naive implementation as it doesn't
attempt to know when it has received all of the data without making one
request past the end, as pagination is implemented in several different
ways across the services. Optimizations to reduce that extra call should
probably be implemented per-service due to those differences.

Change-Id: I63a8eb7836c1a614e4bc2ee98fa93f239b343cbb

commit_message:
add unit tests for GIT* definitions

This adds unit tests for all the GIT* definitions, ensuring that for
libraries we think should be defined, they are. It exposed a bug in
glance_store definitions in the process.

The GITDIR definition for python-openstackclient is moved to stackrc
for testability.

Change-Id: Ibd9ab665f0362a84f4f7e80e80da56a4737f584e

commit_message:
Require dnspython>=1.12.0

The Designate project requires a particular bugfix included in
dnspython 1.12.0 commit 2db54ba975ed5be22f92af105bb2bd6b0ccbbef1.

This buxfix allows for correctly TSIG signing a DNS response
packet.

Change-Id: I4c66dbaf38f4771301106cb4349b64037115972a

commit_message:
Correctly set CombinationAlarm repeat_actions

Previously, the value of the repeat_actions property has no effect on
combination alarm creation, so this attribute defaulted to false on the
Ceilometer side, breaking Heat autoscaling.

Now, this attribute is set correctly as a top-level attribute on the
alarm.

Closes-Bug: #1394159

Change-Id: I1335d5664e9f3f408fbe6815d6cd6fd0a75ba1b8
(cherry picked from commit 02ec693a4701f3423be811a3a5de334c78744465)

commit_message:
Use properties in ceilometer alarm not parsed_template('Properties')

The main point of this patch is to pass the default values defined
in the property schema into ceilometer.

Closes-bug: #1375151
Change-Id: Icfc917a02c2e6404213ec020a9aba24fcbb4168a
(cherry picked from commit adcdf7c9e32b28b1d1ca9ef014e3742f431cb655)

commit_message:
Make sure that property defaults are converted correctly

If a developer defines a default boolean as "true", then we really want
True when we do "self.properties['bla']" not 'true', otherwise this
is not consistent.

Change-Id: I3705e573e2fd68a04b26c5589d38f84d68641738
Partial-bug: #1375151
(cherry picked from commit 04585f6107f7851d10c5393da74a30ac1c9e2c50)

commit_message:
Truncate encoded instance message to 255 or fewer

In nova/compute/utils.py function exception_to_dict truncates unicode
message to 255. However, in non-English locales, instance message may
be longer than 255 after encoding the unicode message to byte message.
Need to truncate the encoded byte message to 255 or fewer, in order to
ensure db insert operation succeed.

Change-Id: I62fa2830b22e367eb9486d09d3c8818a18ebd20d
Closes-Bug: 1389102

subject: Revert "Truncate encoded instance message to 255"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-14 15:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_utils.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Truncate encoded instance message to 255"

This reverts commit bd9c32289ff8cf1bc67c1395ad921c703aa4c489.

UTF-8 character bytes size varies from 1 to 6. If truncating a long
bytes string to 255, the last character may be cut in the middle,
so that UnicodeDecodeError will occur when converting it back to
unicode. Need to revert this code change and make a new patch.

Related-Bug: 1389102

Change-Id: Ie439cffe11d657e77397c9070a3923a61f68a678
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Truncate encoded instance message to 255"

This reverts commit bd9c32289ff8cf1bc67c1395ad921c703aa4c489.

UTF-8 character bytes size varies from 1 to 6. If truncating a long
bytes string to 255, the last character may be cut in the middle,
so that UnicodeDecodeError will occur when converting it back to
unicode. Need to revert this code change and make a new patch.

Related-Bug: 1389102

Change-Id: Ie439cffe11d657e77397c9070a3923a61f68a678

commit_message:
Decrease admin context usage in _get_guest_config

commit 594b18a3 change the context for _get_guest_config
usage to either context given or admin context if it's not
specified. However, it has side effect on later functions
which use the context, so the scope of change the
context should be decreased and this patch fixed that bug.

Change-Id: I7bd96e2c3ee691bae51ac055f57650c14d4e10b4

commit_message:
Replacement `_` on `_LW` in all LOG.warning part 2

oslo.i18n uses different marker functions to separate the
translatable messages into different catalogs, which the translation
teams can prioritize translating. For details, please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#guidelines-for-use-in-openstack

There were not marker fuctions some places in directory network.
This commit makes changes:
* Add missing marker functions
* Use ',' instead of '%' while adding variables to log messages

Change-Id: I5ab13610d3e10a68ae49f9fd7fac151aa66ea98d

commit_message:
Replacement `_` on `_LW` in all LOG.warning part 1

oslo.i18n uses different marker functions to separate the
translatable messages into different catalogs, which the translation
teams can prioritize translating. For details, please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#guidelines-for-use-in-openstack

There were not marker fuctions some places in directory network.
This commit makes changes:
* Add missing marker functions
* Use ',' instead of '%' while adding variables to log messages

Added a hacking rule for the warning about checking
translation for it and checking logging level `warning` instead
alias `warn`.

Change-Id: I2bced49dc5a0408a94d5d20d85b20c682886edbe

subject: Add iptables to log dropped packets
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 17:59:07.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Add iptables to log dropped packets

Adds a rule to the bottom of the openstack-INPUT chain to log any
packets that make it this far and are on their way to being rejected.
This may help us find out why Devstack Ironic VM nodes occasionally cannot
reach the host's TFTP server.

A different approach to 135694

Change-Id: I21a921e25ac6bdf8440e285ab0fb1c6ceb229253
Related-bug: #1393099
"}]
commit_message:
Add iptables to log dropped packets

Adds a rule to the bottom of the openstack-INPUT chain to log any
packets that make it this far and are on their way to being rejected.
This may help us find out why Devstack Ironic VM nodes occasionally cannot
reach the host's TFTP server.

A different approach to 135694

Change-Id: I21a921e25ac6bdf8440e285ab0fb1c6ceb229253
Related-bug: #1393099

translatable messages into different catalogs, which the translation
teams can prioritize translating.  For details, please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#guidelines-for-use-in-openstack

There were not marker fuctions some places in directory network.
This commit makes changes:
* Add missing marker functions
* Use ',' instead of '%' while adding variables to log messages

Added a hacking rule for the log exception about checking
translation for it.

commit_message:
Fix context.elevated

Replace copy.copy() with copy.deepcopy() in 'elevated' method of RequestContext
class to remove addition of admin role to original context that can be used by
malicious users.

Change-Id: Ie28acd9c6c9c75ab00f440b49996a1de7523158b
Closes-bug: #1386932

commit_message:
Added functionality to allow for zone ownership transfers

This includes 3 new API endpoints in the v2 API

/v2/zones/<id>/tasks/transfer_requests
/v2/zones/tasks/transfer_requests
/v2/zones/tasks/transfer_accepts

Change-Id: Ic5fd5a3b0a309346fbb72407771f88f8dbcfe17c
implements: zone-migration-between-tenants

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-08-12 13:34:18.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder-volume/os-refresh-config/configure.d/99-cinder-host-pairing'], 'message': "Set up cinder-volume nodes pairing

This change adds a config script for cinder-volume meant to
customize the cinder `host` setting to pair up the nodes; this
workaround the Cinder's volumes locality issues.

The number of hosts sharing the same `host` group is configurable
via the cinder.hostgroups.size setting; so is the type of nodes to
be paired via cinder.hostgroups.node_type

Hosts pairing is enabled via cinder.hostgroups.enabled

Change-Id: I82086a31b90711de7ea3d8d3945608179bcb1861
"}]
commit_message:
Set up cinder-volume nodes pairing

This change adds a config script for cinder-volume meant to
customize the cinder `host` setting to pair up the nodes; this
workaround the Cinder's volumes locality issues.

The number of hosts sharing the same `host` group is configurable
via the cinder.hostgroups.size setting; so is the type of nodes to
be paired via cinder.hostgroups.node_type

Hosts pairing is enabled via cinder.hostgroups.enabled

Change-Id: I82086a31b90711de7ea3d8d3945608179bcb1861

commit_message:
make run_tests.sh run devstack unit tests

run_tests.sh was created as an entry point for bashate. We stopped
using it now that we know how to run bashate directly in the gate.
We lost running an unrelated bashate test when that happened.

Devstack does have unit tests. We don't run them. We should.
Especially when working on things like the LIBS_FROM_GIT which is
sufficiently tricky that we really need to add unit tests to ensure
that we don't break it.

Conflicts:
	run_tests.sh

Change-Id: Ife067855569e2eae4c085471d326e8086de37332
(cherry picked from commit 9f20ea13826234ac2c508ea1d50a0822b68d42dc)

commit_message:
make run_tests.sh run devstack unit tests

run_tests.sh was created as an entry point for bashate. We stopped
using it now that we know how to run bashate directly in the gate.
We lost running an unrelated bashate test when that happened.

Devstack does have unit tests. We don't run them. We should.
Especially when working on things like the LIBS_FROM_GIT which is
sufficiently tricky that we really need to add unit tests to ensure
that we don't break it.

Conflicts:
	run_tests.sh

Change-Id: Ife067855569e2eae4c085471d326e8086de37332
(cherry picked from commit 9f20ea13826234ac2c508ea1d50a0822b68d42dc)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-20 03:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_rpc_client.py', 'heat/rpc/client.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_config.py', 'heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_component.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_deployment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/multi_part.py'], 'message': "Handle remote thrown NotFound RPC exceptions

This is a short-term fix for a regression caused by
If81b68717bd2f9d9be1291c07b18626493c9b5cc which results in undeletable
config and deployment resource if the underlying config or deployment
no longer exists.

Longer term there will be a ClientPlugin for making heat RPC calls
which wraps the remote exceptions and raises the original type.

The EngineClient methods local_error_name and ignore_error_named
will still be useful when this ClientPlugin exists, they just won't
be called directly from resources.

Change-Id: I8407e04c0404dd6560273d7d74744b5bb7774520
"}]
commit_message:
Handle remote thrown NotFound RPC exceptions

This is a short-term fix for a regression caused by
If81b68717bd2f9d9be1291c07b18626493c9b5cc which results in undeletable
config and deployment resource if the underlying config or deployment
no longer exists.

Longer term there will be a ClientPlugin for making heat RPC calls
which wraps the remote exceptions and raises the original type.

The EngineClient methods local_error_name and ignore_error_named
will still be useful when this ClientPlugin exists, they just won't
be called directly from resources.

Change-Id: I8407e04c0404dd6560273d7d74744b5bb7774520

commit_message:
Check nodes availability using mcollective

If we talk about provisioning operation,
first mcollective operation will be 'erase_node'
from mcollective 'erase_node' agent.

We just need stop deployment if any of nodes
got problem with erasing.

This fix help to detect problem with bootstrap
image as early as possible.

Change-Id: I3047f7cc097eda5e63099f0299f7696c15fba10f
Closes-Bug: #1373988

commit_message:
fix tempest-lib setup

The setup should have been with setup_dev_lib, which looks up the path
from GITDIR. This should let tempest-lib src jobs function.

Change-Id: Ia160708c089adce469d878030196b6fed8acc92d

commit_message:
Explicitly requeue rabbitmq message in case process interupted

In case if process is interrupted excplit requeue will be
requested

Dont think that we should consider dead-letter exchanges
at this point, becauce messaging traffic is low, and only
thing that we need is reliably process message after
receiverd restarted

DocImpact
Change-Id: If530049b6e519ceb03de0cfd82c3449cdb616f50
Related-Bug: 1383511

commit_message:

out.

commit_message:
tokens: add a Swift backend

This adds a Swift based backend to Keystone tokens.
It stores tokens in a common container, and uses a container per
user/tenant/trust to index and list them. The expiration of the tokens
is automatically handled by the Swift expirer feature.

Change-Id: I5b88fab9ac5615993d4f83520b16db58852e0f41

For class-loading purposes we can just use the major version,
so accept that. Only Identity and Compute were affected; Compute
is included just to be pedantically complete.

For command groups we also just use the major version so fix
Compute and the version option handling.

Change the internal default for Identity to a simple '2' so it
is also consistent with the rest of the world.

Then comes microversioning...

Closes-Bug: #1292638
Change-Id: Ibaf823b31caa288a83de38d2c258860b128b87d8
"}]
commit_message:
Liberalize version matching a bit

For class-loading purposes we can just use the major version,
so accept that. Only Identity and Compute were affected; Compute
is included just to be pedantically complete.

For command groups we also just use the major version so fix
Compute and the version option handling.

Change the internal default for Identity to a simple '2' so it
is also consistent with the rest of the world.

Then comes microversioning...

Closes-Bug: #1292638
Change-Id: Ibaf823b31caa288a83de38d2c258860b128b87d8

commit_message:
Add integration tests to the Horizon check gate

Now that the job passes on master, time to verify its stability by
running it on all incoming patchsets. The job is already marked as
non-voting, so just move it to the check queue for now and make sure it
doesn't run on any of the stable branches.

Change-Id: I09a1c18cf1fce7f1e981b0b2ec68456729ba16b7

New host volume /etc/puppet maps to rsync container /puppet,
freeing up /etc/puppet:/etc/puppet mapping, which may be enabled
for some desired testing function.
This also has a desired benefit to use bundled manifests when
deploying rsync container, but still serve arbitrary host puppet

Closes-Bug: #1382531
'}]
commit_message:
Create dedicated puppet volume for rsync container

New host volume /etc/puppet maps to rsync container /puppet,
freeing up /etc/puppet:/etc/puppet mapping, which may be enabled
for some desired testing function.
This also has a desired benefit to use bundled manifests when
deploying rsync container, but still serve arbitrary host puppet
contents via rsync.

Change-Id: I6e7f29679a7d475a6c49dd6e3d498c14c943408f
Closes-Bug: #1382531

2) Separate configuration for account-server.conf,

commit_message:
Fixed swift issues in installation guide

I fixed the following swift issues in the installation guide:

1) Install the keystone middleware package on proxy nodes to
   resolve dependency on standalone proxy nodes that don't
   run the keystone service.
2) Separate configuration for account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf, and object-server.conf files due
   due to unique port value for each service.

Change-Id: Ice5b5b6baa3488acc8b86f587c1efd728f034f8c
Closes-Bug: #1394025
Closes-Bug: #1394640
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit b7034ee42ac0119ab6500fbbefa517f62fdaaec1)

commit_message:
Update neutron ML2 configuration

I updated the installation guide neutron ML2 configuration to
use the newer '[agent] tunnel_types' option instead of the
'[ovs] tunnel_type' option. I also improved the description of
a few steps.

Change-Id: I9ddc150b7f09b15afaf1b9a4113a0fb8b13fe032
Closes-Bug: #1391097
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit 300aaf719d6088096d0914df4375384f930a9605)

logic and removes unused network_id from resource's name.

name looks like 'router_id'. Also, it still supports compatibility

commit_message:
Change RouterGateway resource's name

This patch changes RouterGateway resource's name building
logic and removes unused network_id from resource's name.
If name looked like 'router_id:network_id' earlier, now resource's
name looks like 'router_id'. Also, it still supports compatibility
with old resource's names, which look like 'router_id:network_id'.

Change-Id: I33b589870f26761802de84046281b0c626a9e03c

commit_message:
Remove ryu plugin

Ryu plugin was marked deprecated in Juno and will be removed for Kilo.

Also, mention Ryu team's recommendation for ofagent in
doc/config-reference/networking/section_networking-plugins.xml

We (Ryu team) recommend users to migrate to ofagent, on which
we aim to concentrate our development resources by this deprecation.

Partial-Bug: #1391714
Change-Id: Ia11ce42f1cd3ad9d1ccc2e7bf2c2937d7ee5406e

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-31 10:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/transport.py'], 'message': 'Documentation anomaly in TransportURL parse classmethod

The documentation for the classmethod `parse` states that

    The last parsed username and password will be propagated to the rest
    of hosts specified::
    user:pass@host1:port1,host2:port2
    [
    {"username": "user", "password": "pass", "host": "host1:port1"},
    {"username": "user", "password": "pass", "host": "host2:port2"}
    ]

However, in practice one needs to specify the usernames and passwords
individually with every host.

DocImpact: Documentation needs to be changed due anomaly in TransportURL
parse classmethod.

Change-Id: I1a9e07e0380a0d6f7d00731df93c9ba01ae20e0e
Closes-Bug: #1355684
'}]
commit_message:
Documentation anomaly in TransportURL parse classmethod

The documentation for the classmethod `parse` states that

    The last parsed username and password will be propagated to the rest
    of hosts specified::
    user:pass@host1:port1,host2:port2
    [
    {"username": "user", "password": "pass", "host": "host1:port1"},
    {"username": "user", "password": "pass", "host": "host2:port2"}
    ]

However, in practice one needs to specify the usernames and passwords
individually with every host.

DocImpact: Documentation needs to be changed due anomaly in TransportURL
parse classmethod.

Change-Id: I1a9e07e0380a0d6f7d00731df93c9ba01ae20e0e
Closes-Bug: #1355684

commit_message:
Changed snapshot compress algoritm from gz to xz

The reason for this change is that
XZ archive is around two times smaller than GZIP

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia8ba5d584ea97de4f476cb8bb632ca82baa76503
Closes-Bug: 1394487

commit_message:
glance member-delete shows a clear error message

A call with nonexistant member-id results in
"No images shared with tenant '<tenant id>' can be found"
instead of former vague 'Membership could not be found'.

Besides some dead code has been removed from index_shared_images and a
few more tests written for the case.

Change-Id: Ie5360dc3bd9037b5cf9686ea29d2315d06eec07f
Closes-bug: #1390025

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}, {'_account_id': 12561, 'name': 'Adrien Vergé', 'email': 'adrienverge@gmail.com', 'username': 'adrien.verge'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-20 14:04:17.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/volumes.py'], 'message': 'Format volumes filesystems in parallel

Formatting in ext4 can be a long operation (several minutes for large
disks). With multiple volumes per instance, this significantly increases
cluster set-up time.

Since formatting and mounting can be done in parallel (bottleneck is
disk IO, not CPU), spawn a thread for each volume.

This change applies to the Heat engine only, because the direct engine
also attach devices to instances and this must be done sequentially.

Change-Id: Ie0d47c0906da7c123383646842003675096a2fc7
Closes-Bug: #1394593
'}]
commit_message:
Format volumes filesystems in parallel

Formatting in ext4 can be a long operation (several minutes for large
disks). With multiple volumes per instance, this significantly increases
cluster set-up time.

Since formatting and mounting can be done in parallel (bottleneck is
disk IO, not CPU), spawn a thread for each volume.

This change applies to the Heat engine only, because the direct engine
also attach devices to instances and this must be done sequentially.

Change-Id: Ie0d47c0906da7c123383646842003675096a2fc7
Closes-Bug: #1394593

commit_message:
Fix stunnel SSL options

This actually never worked properly before. Stunnel compares everything
in the value to all known options. So it was looking for an option named
literally "NO_SSLv2 NO_SSLv3".

Change-Id: Iaa04a2d4a2e6d7f527cf7112a12f19f20c0b1411

commit_message:
Decrese agent to log to INFO level after uid is received

Biggest part of agent logs is information about disks discovery
which is DEBUG level

Any changes with disks will be available in nailgun api log

Change-Id: Idecbb1a4b045ea126acd04b6164b93e9c1fb1d0f
Closes-Bug: 1393115

commit_message:
Magnum is not ready for requirements check

Magnum needs docker-py library etc, so it's not ready for us
to run check-requirements job. Let us please disable this
for now.

Change-Id: I6acb6c0bc7d73204229ca97acd3eda02052652f5

commit_message:
Add functional test for update of group of provider resources

A new test which tests the (previously buggy) behavior when updating
a nested stack of more than one level of nesting, specifically updating
a ResourceGroup which contains provider resources.

Change-Id: I8abfd99f1ecc2cc84410fb552f18f93e47144c17
Related-Bug: #1389499

commit_message:
Logrotate more aggressively on debug mode

Debug log rotation occurs every 10 minutes,
so that disk space can be conserved when running
applications with high volume of logs.

Change-Id: Ia50d3b0ec96a9ef411238bea0e6d162ca02ebe08
Closes-Bug: #1393404
(cherry picked from commit 498350bbc71283529bf5201773e4e00f10106a88)

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-11-21 11:24:54.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/conductor/handlers/default.py', 'magnum/conductor/__init__.py', 'magnum/conductor/api.py', 'magnum/conductor/config.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'magnum/cmd/conductor.py'], 'message': 'Add initial conductor API and service

Add an initial conductor API and service.  This service allows
operation on the four object types -> bays, pods, services, and
containers and allows the ability to list, read, write, or delete
those objects in the database.  The implementation of the
list/read/write/delete is incomplete and should come in a follow-up
patch.

Change-Id: I60e9070e4b5aeaeddba67233b99dd0e3a3cffe22
'}]
commit_message:
Add initial conductor API and service

Add an initial conductor API and service.  This service allows
operation on the four object types -> bays, pods, services, and
containers and allows the ability to list, read, write, or delete
those objects in the database.  The implementation of the
list/read/write/delete is incomplete and should come in a follow-up
patch.

Change-Id: I60e9070e4b5aeaeddba67233b99dd0e3a3cffe22

commit_message:
Create dedicated puppet volume for rsync container

New host volume /etc/puppet maps to rsync container /puppet,
freeing up /etc/puppet:/etc/puppet mapping, which may be enabled
for some desired testing function.
This also has a desired benefit to use bundled manifests when
deploying rsync container, but still serve arbitrary host puppet
contents via rsync.

Change-Id: I6e7f29679a7d475a6c49dd6e3d498c14c943408f
Closes-Bug: #1382531

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-19 14:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Add exception filter for _sqlite_dupe_key_error

We can get 'PRIMARY KEY must be unique' error on some
platforms and versions of sqlite library while trying to
insert the row with the same primary key that already exist.
In this case oslo.db should raise DBDuplicateEntry error.
Add corresponding filter to _sqlite_dupe_key_error

Closes-Bug: #1386145

Change-Id: Ifafd6a8e0b613a31e596043071aef4d410a976f2
"}]
commit_message:
Add exception filter for _sqlite_dupe_key_error

We can get 'PRIMARY KEY must be unique' error on some
platforms and versions of sqlite library while trying to
insert the row with the same primary key that already exist.
In this case oslo.db should raise DBDuplicateEntry error.
Add corresponding filter to _sqlite_dupe_key_error

Closes-Bug: #1386145

Change-Id: Ifafd6a8e0b613a31e596043071aef4d410a976f2

commit_message:
register_all_nodes() now accepts keystoneclient

os_cloud_config.nodes.register_all_nodes() was a little bad in the
fact that it would warn that it was creating a Keystone client, but
you couldn't pass one in to silence the warning. Since this warns
everytime register-nodes is run, silence it.

Change-Id: I5e70df9a91f53f706e414ed041270f2c620977d2

commit_message:
Remove VirtNUMAHostTopology.claim_test() method

Previous patches in this series remove the need for this method, so this
patch removes it.

We also remove the can_fit_instances() method which is now part of the
get_fitting_for_instance().

Change-Id: Ieb285bd7e06ea5c5bfc429ccad856272e147f885

commit_message:
supporting lxc cpu mode
The default cpu_mode with the lxc libvirt type doesn't support the
cpu_mode configuration. If one is defined, the nova-compute service
will fail.

Change-Id: I9f8db15c772f7555d552ee4d9b9e85eb2d78f91e

This patch makes the NUMATopologyFilter and instance claims on the
compute host use instance fitting logic to allow for actually packing

commit_message:
Instances with NUMA will be packed onto hosts

This patch makes the NUMATopologyFilter and instance claims on the
compute host use instance fitting logic to allow for actually packing
instances onto NUMA capable hosts.

This also means that the NUMA placement that is calculated during a
successfull claim will need to be updated in the database to reflect the
host NUMA cell ids the instance cells will be pinned to.

Using fit_instance_to_host() to decide weather an instance can land
on a host makes the NUMATopologyFilter code cleaner as it now fully
re-uses all the logic in VirtNUMAHostTopology and
VirtNUMATopologyCellUsage classes.

Change-Id: Ieabafea73b4d566f4194ca60be38b6415d8a8f3d
Closes-bug: #1386236

This is needed so that we can actually update the given topology with
the updated data after a successful claim.

Deleting it will also be needed when we actually make the resize work
properly for instances with NUMA topology, so we add it here as well.

We do not expose the new InstanceNUMATopology methods as @remotable to
avoid having to bump the object version thus making this an easier
backport target. This is OK since they are only called from
Instance.save() which is @remotable, and can be trivially made remotable
should this be needed later (causing a version bump that need not be
backported).

Partial-bug: #1386236
'}]
commit_message:
Make Instance.save() update numa_topology

This is needed so that we can actually update the given topology with
the updated data after a successful claim.

Deleting it will also be needed when we actually make the resize work
properly for instances with NUMA topology, so we add it here as well.

We do not expose the new InstanceNUMATopology methods as @remotable to
avoid having to bump the object version thus making this an easier
backport target. This is OK since they are only called from
Instance.save() which is @remotable, and can be trivially made remotable
should this be needed later (causing a version bump that need not be
backported).

Change-Id: I64ff2d00ca20bd065bb17ebaa9c40b64b8cbb817
Partial-bug: #1386236

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 21:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['tools/subunit-trace.py', 'tox.ini', 'tools/pretty_tox.sh'], 'message': 'Show progress output while running unit tests

This patch imports some magic to enable showing test output as the
tests run.  Seeing output showing tests as they execute is reassuring
that the test run is continuing to make progress.  This originated in
tempest and was then brought over to Nova in this commit:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121914/

Note the justification in that commit to just copy it instead of move
it to a shared repo.

To get the old behavior where you only get output when something
fails, you can set the TRACE_FAILONLY env var.  That originated in
this commit in Nova:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123801/

Change-Id: I6a079ad5f630383650c0f9dee09e04250d0e2c5a
'}]
commit_message:
Show progress output while running unit tests

This patch imports some magic to enable showing test output as the
tests run.  Seeing output showing tests as they execute is reassuring
that the test run is continuing to make progress.  This originated in
tempest and was then brought over to Nova in this commit:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121914/

Note the justification in that commit to just copy it instead of move
it to a shared repo.

To get the old behavior where you only get output when something
fails, you can set the TRACE_FAILONLY env var.  That originated in
this commit in Nova:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123801/

commit_message:
Ensure 'leave_group' result gotten before further work

Avoid the case where 'client3' doesn't leave the group before
we start to check for that removal in the main client by using
the get() operation on the 'client3' leave_group() operation.

Change-Id: I4f1cc3ea1088d0cd026023c72018ee6716b9bbc8

commit_message:
Fix for adopt glance.store library in Glance

The store module is removed from glance project and new glance_store
module is created, but the glance project code was not updated
properly for the required changes.

_get_from_store and _get_size methods raises store.NotFound exception
from glance_store but not caught in the glance api.

Updated exception.NotFound to store.NotFound which returns 404 NotFound
response to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1380552
Change-Id: I068cb90f5db62443115157a027fbdefec9bd4a00
(cherry picked from commit 675a39a74faad5f7fe4eb94e1dcf7f4359ed2285)

This commit adds a missing check for the too_slow_to_test flag on the
swift notification scenario test. On stable icehouse, without the
performance improvements from juno, this test is basically a crapshoot.

commit_message:
Add check for too_slow_to_test flag on swift notification test

This commit adds a missing check for the too_slow_to_test flag on the
swift notification scenario test. On stable icehouse, without the
performance improvements from juno, this test is basically a crapshoot.
Checking if the environment is capable of running this test reliably
needs to be ensured prior to running the test.

Change-Id: I1c69341bfbd9b7540ca9cacae32dbaef2c526f93
Partial-Bug: #1394774

commit_message:
Prevent an iteration through ports on IPv6 slaac

A recent change[1] allowed subnets to be deleted even if they
had active IPv6 SLAAC allocations on them. The updated check
was inefficient because it would check every port in the subnet
even if the subnet was a SLAAC subnet. This patch just shortcuts
out that check.

1. I281f5a1553248e09174dc49d0a42aef4b5c44bee

Change-Id: I2c35495b3642c644e4758f28ccddcc076139ec3b

[{'number': 19, 'created': '2014-10-15 22:17:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ofagent/agent/ofa_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_l2population_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l2population_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_l2population.py', 'neutron/agent/l2population_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ofagent/test_ofa_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Refactor l2_pop code to pass mac/ip info more readably

Previous code used a 2 element array to represent a mac/ip address
pair.  Code assumed that element 0 was mac and 1 was ip.  This made
the code difficult to read and difficult to maintain.  An attempt was
made to insert a third value that failed miserably because of the
position dependence and other code that assumed not only positions but
also the number of elements.

Using a namedtuple seems to be the best way to get better
maintainability.  Named tuples can be compared with regular tuples.
The json serializer still uses an array to represent it so the on-wire
representation of the object has not changed.  A short snip of code
was required to restore the namedtuple from the RPC message.

Change-Id: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
Closes-Bug: #1352801
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor l2_pop code to pass mac/ip info more readably

Previous code used a 2 element array to represent a mac/ip address
pair.  Code assumed that element 0 was mac and 1 was ip.  This made
the code difficult to read and difficult to maintain.  An attempt was
made to insert a third value that failed miserably because of the
position dependence and other code that assumed not only positions but
also the number of elements.

Using a namedtuple seems to be the best way to get better
maintainability.  Named tuples can be compared with regular tuples.
The json serializer still uses an array to represent it so the on-wire
representation of the object has not changed.  A short snip of code
was required to restore the namedtuple from the RPC message.

Change-Id: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
Closes-Bug: #1352801

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2014-11-19 05:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_router_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_restproxy_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_servermanager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_security_groups.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_ssl.py', 'neutron/plugins/bigswitch/servermanager.py', 'neutron/plugins/bigswitch/db/consistency_db.py'], 'message': "BSN: Optimistic locking strategy for consistency

Summary:
  Adds an optimistic locking strategy for the Big Switch
  server manager so multiple Neutron servers wanting to
  communicate with the backend do not receive the consistency
  hash for use simultaneously.

  The bsn-rest-call semaphore is removed because serialization
  is now provided by the new locking scheme.

  A new DB engine is added because the consistency hashes
  need a life-cycle with rollbacks and other DB operations
  than cannot impact or be impacted by database operations
  happening on the regular Neutron objects.

  Unit tests are included for each of the new branches
  introduced.

Problem Statement:
  Requests to the Big Switch controllers must contain the
  consistency hash value received from the previous update.
  Otherwise, an inconsistency error will be triggered which
  will force a synchronization. Essentially, a new backend
  call must be prevented from reading from the consistency
  hash table in the DB until the previous call has updated
  the table with the hash from the server response.

  This can be addressed by a semaphore around the rest_call
  function for the single server use case and by a table lock
  on the consistency table for multiple Neutron servers.
  However, both solutions are inadequate because a single
  Neutron server does not scale and a table lock is not
  supported by common SQL HA deployments (e.g. Galera).

  This issue was previously addressed by deploying servers
  in an active-standby configuration. However, that only
  prevented the problem for HTTP API calls. All Neutron
  servers would respond to RPC messages, some of which would
  result in a port update and possible backend call which
  would trigger a conflict if it happened at the same time
  as a backend call from another server. These unnecessary
  syncs are unsustainable as the topology increases beyond
  ~3k VMs.

  Any solution needs to be back-portable to Icehouse so new
  database tables, new requirements, etc. are all out of the
  question.

Solution:
  This patch stores the lock for the consistency hash as a part
  of the DB record. The guaruntees the database offers around
  atomic insertion and constrained atomic updates offer the
  primitives necessary to ensure that only one process/thread
  can lock the record at once.

  The read_for_update method is modified to not return the hash
  in the database until an identifier is inserted into the
  current record or added as a new record. By using an UPDATE
  query with a WHERE clause restricting to the current state,
  only one of many concurrent callers to the DB will successfully
  update the rows. If a caller sees that it didn't update any
  rows, it will start the process over of trying to get the
  lock.

  If a caller observes that the same ID has the lock for
  more than 60 seconds, it will assume the holder has
  died and will attempt to take the lock. This is also done
  in a concurrency-safe UPDATE call since there may be many
  other callers may attempt to do the same thing. If it
  fails and the lock was taken by someone else, the process
  will start over.

  Some pseudo-code resembling the logic:
    read_current_lock
    if no_record:
      insert_lock
      sleep_and_retry if constraint_violation else return
    if current_is_locked and not timer_exceeded:
      sleep_and_retry
    if update_record_with_lock:
      return
    else:
      sleep_and_retry

Closes-Bug: #1374261
Change-Id: Ifa5a7c9749952bc2785a9bf3fed69ad55bf21acc
"}]
commit_message:
BSN: Optimistic locking strategy for consistency

Summary:
  Adds an optimistic locking strategy for the Big Switch
  server manager so multiple Neutron servers wanting to
  communicate with the backend do not receive the consistency
  hash for use simultaneously.

  The bsn-rest-call semaphore is removed because serialization
  is now provided by the new locking scheme.

  A new DB engine is added because the consistency hashes
  need a life-cycle with rollbacks and other DB operations
  than cannot impact or be impacted by database operations
  happening on the regular Neutron objects.

  Unit tests are included for each of the new branches
  introduced.

Problem Statement:
  Requests to the Big Switch controllers must contain the
  consistency hash value received from the previous update.
  Otherwise, an inconsistency error will be triggered which
  will force a synchronization. Essentially, a new backend
  call must be prevented from reading from the consistency
  hash table in the DB until the previous call has updated
  the table with the hash from the server response.

  This can be addressed by a semaphore around the rest_call
  function for the single server use case and by a table lock
  on the consistency table for multiple Neutron servers.
  However, both solutions are inadequate because a single
  Neutron server does not scale and a table lock is not
  supported by common SQL HA deployments (e.g. Galera).

  This issue was previously addressed by deploying servers
  in an active-standby configuration. However, that only
  prevented the problem for HTTP API calls. All Neutron
  servers would respond to RPC messages, some of which would
  result in a port update and possible backend call which
  would trigger a conflict if it happened at the same time
  as a backend call from another server. These unnecessary
  syncs are unsustainable as the topology increases beyond
  ~3k VMs.

  Any solution needs to be back-portable to Icehouse so new
  database tables, new requirements, etc. are all out of the
  question.

Solution:
  This patch stores the lock for the consistency hash as a part
  of the DB record. The guaruntees the database offers around
  atomic insertion and constrained atomic updates offer the
  primitives necessary to ensure that only one process/thread
  can lock the record at once.

  The read_for_update method is modified to not return the hash
  in the database until an identifier is inserted into the
  current record or added as a new record. By using an UPDATE
  query with a WHERE clause restricting to the current state,
  only one of many concurrent callers to the DB will successfully
  update the rows. If a caller sees that it didn't update any
  rows, it will start the process over of trying to get the
  lock.

  If a caller observes that the same ID has the lock for
  more than 60 seconds, it will assume the holder has
  died and will attempt to take the lock. This is also done
  in a concurrency-safe UPDATE call since there may be many
  other callers may attempt to do the same thing. If it
  fails and the lock was taken by someone else, the process
  will start over.

  Some pseudo-code resembling the logic:
    read_current_lock
    if no_record:
      insert_lock
      sleep_and_retry if constraint_violation else return
    if current_is_locked and not timer_exceeded:
      sleep_and_retry
    if update_record_with_lock:
      return
    else:
      sleep_and_retry

Closes-Bug: #1374261
Change-Id: Ifa5a7c9749952bc2785a9bf3fed69ad55bf21acc

commit_message:
Corrected IPv6 Address Configuration Mode tooltip

Corrected this tooltip to reflect the actual name of the option:
'No options specified' instead of the incorrect: 'No option selected'.
Also made minor adjustments for grammar.

Change-Id: I0f89390cf0dbfdd3775fc9985b2dd77512593ac8
Closes-Bug: 1394581

commit_message:
Enable default SNAT from networks connected to a router indirectly

Make outgoing packets to an external interface SNATed regardless
of source address of the packets. As a result of deep review,
any problem was not found with this change.

Change-Id: I71a1288633bb6af2951d571540bbb9ec5e1270e2
Closes-bug: #1386041

commit_message:
Wrong order of assertEquals args(Glance)

Args of assertEquals method in glance.tests are arranged
in wrong order. In result when test fails it shows incorrect
information about observed and actual data. It's found more
than 2000 times. Right order of arguments is "expected, actual".

Change-Id: Ifea4809f5a696b608a19e36a9ed9e5eec46c8a21
Co-Authored-By: Li Yingjun <liyingjun1988@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1277104

commit_message:
Remove KeypairConstraint and FlavorConstraint to nova.py

All nova custom constraints should be defined in
nova.py as neutron custom constraints.
And this change also remove the corresponding tests
to test_nova_client.py

Change-Id: Ie40192b5d53d60d2d4e152801cbd8583e6c45dac
Implements: blueprint nova-custom-constraints
