commit_message:
Prepare build environment

1. In case Ubuntu 14.04:
- add devops repository and install multistrap version 2.1.6
- Pin multistrap version 2.1.6
2. In case Ubuntu 12.04:
- add chris-lea (for nodejs) repository with higher priority
- install nodejs from chris-lea repository
3. For all distributions
- fixed npm global installation permission issue
- ensure bc package is present for make img target

Closes-Bug: #1337343
Closes-Bug: #1312654
Change-Id: I62ba9257fb3d575d996bf4c57b5d983c0050fd3b
(cherry picked from commit d5f87ec202bbd490273ea756c4ec2173d8580ef2)

commit_message:
Implement custom constraint for nova server

Many resources have 'InstanceId' property related
with nova server, add nova server custom constraint
to validate the existent of the server.

Implements: blueprint nova-custom-constraints

commit_message:
Add obj_set_defaults() to NovaObject

This provides a way to set the default values on fields that have them.
Previously, defaults were only set on nullable fields when set to None,
which wasn't universally-useful.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ie646c0363d4af22ec8a588a6a1567c30bab99ebb

commit_message:
Mark stack_domain_admin_password as a secret option

Add secret=True to option stack_domain_admin_password,
so that will avoid logging this option in engine.log.

Closes-Bug: #1392162
Change-Id: I04071f37a0053b969dc31a69e62ba9abb075c590
(cherry picked from commit 0307d0267713ed18309ecea5359f002d388eaf34)

[{'number': 27, 'created': '2014-11-03 12:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_vpc.py', 'heat/engine/resources/security_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_security_group.py'], 'message': 'Implement update of AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup rules

Such functionality is supported by AWS [1], is present in
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup but was missing from AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup.
Updates for both Neutron and Nova-Network security groups are
implemented.
Updates are performed on per-rule basis with minimal interruption.
The implementation splits the code in two helper classes implementing
Nova and Neutron API orchestraion.

Also, security groups APIs mocks are brought closer to reality.

[1] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-security-group.html

Change-Id: I86a04612567bd6080d1b825bc58acc9a08f0c2a4
Implements: blueprint handle-update-for-security-groups
'}]
commit_message:
Implement update of AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup rules

Such functionality is supported by AWS [1], is present in
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup but was missing from AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup.
Updates for both Neutron and Nova-Network security groups are
implemented.
Updates are performed on per-rule basis with minimal interruption.
The implementation splits the code in two helper classes implementing
Nova and Neutron API orchestraion.

Also, security groups APIs mocks are brought closer to reality.

[1] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-security-group.html

Change-Id: I86a04612567bd6080d1b825bc58acc9a08f0c2a4
Implements: blueprint handle-update-for-security-groups

Use the -e parameter in template-validate to override any

commit_message:
Use environment file in template-validate

Use the -e parameter in template-validate to override any
Default values specified in the template.  This has the desirable
effect of making Horizon use parameters updated from the environment
file.

Change-Id: I84405d1d2f5245ab7cb8b909c2ea1407d5b2973e
Closes-Bug: #1388985

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-11-19 17:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/rpc_api.rst'], 'message': 'Add some basic rpc api docs

The devref docs had a placeholder file for rpc API docs.  Now that
both a client side and server side interface have been converted from
the rpc compat layer to oslo.messaging APIs, add some docs that give
an overview of what the client and server sides look like.

Also include a section that describes the code layout of where you can
find client and server api implementations in the neutron code base.
It starts by discussing the DHCP agent related APIs.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Ib391958252077365a81bcb881ab27a078f71fdec
'}]
commit_message:
Add some basic rpc api docs

The devref docs had a placeholder file for rpc API docs.  Now that
both a client side and server side interface have been converted from
the rpc compat layer to oslo.messaging APIs, add some docs that give
an overview of what the client and server sides look like.

Also include a section that describes the code layout of where you can
find client and server api implementations in the neutron code base.
It starts by discussing the DHCP agent related APIs.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Ib391958252077365a81bcb881ab27a078f71fdec

commit_message:
Add user_creds_id to _create_stack RPC interface

Adds the ability to pass the parent user_creds_id into nested stacks
when creating them via RPC, so we can maintain the current behavior
in StackResource, where the parent user_creds record is used by all
nested stacks.

Change-Id: Ifed93860db68a7d23b0c05bd9ec83619e109e386
blueprint: decouple-nested

commit_message:
Update state of table batch actions based on row selection

This fixes the problem where only buttons having the class
"btn-danger" are enabled or disabled based on row selection.
Button state will now be updated for all table batch actions.

Closes-Bug: 1319458
Change-Id: I9f51672781b294abe8385ef9576653ebd6f1bf43

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-20 14:18:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/neutron/security_group.py'], 'message': 'Add requirement to SecurityGroup "remote_group_id"

"remote_group_id" propertie needs to be set only if "remote_mode" is
set to "remote_group_id". If "remote_mode" is in its default value,
remote_group_id is ignored, there is no error message.

There is no clue to understand that remote_mode should be set to
another value, except reading all SecurityGroup properties.
Also, remote_mode does not appear in "neutron security-group-show"
output.

Change-Id: Icdf698a6d7b5539bbc7c4426aa88250229f795f0
'}]
commit_message:
Add requirement to SecurityGroup "remote_group_id"

"remote_group_id" propertie needs to be set only if "remote_mode" is
set to "remote_group_id". If "remote_mode" is in its default value,
remote_group_id is ignored, there is no error message.

There is no clue to understand that remote_mode should be set to
another value, except reading all SecurityGroup properties.
Also, remote_mode does not appear in "neutron security-group-show"
output.

Change-Id: Icdf698a6d7b5539bbc7c4426aa88250229f795f0

commit_message:
Fixed issue with vlan on redhat provider

When interface is a vlan, the VLAN=yes stanza must stick to interface
configuration file and shouldn't be present on bridge ifcfg file either

RHBZ#1160418

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1918, 'name': 'François Charlier', 'email': 'francois.charlier@redhat.com', 'username': 'francois-charlier'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 9060, 'name': 'Mike Dorman', 'email': 'dorm@dorm.org', 'username': 'gd-mdorman'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 15:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': "Put $bind_address in vhost config only if it's explicitly specified

Only add the 'ip' element to the $default_vhost_conf hash if it was explicitly
specified in the instantiation of the class.  This is because ip => undef gets
changed to ip => '' via the Puppet function API when ensure_resource is called.
For port => 80, that causes a conflict with the Apache module's default
port 80 vhost listener.

Change-Id: I504857aca99a7a3c42ee17242bcc0dea33f1b6e4
Closes-Bug: 1371345
"}]
commit_message:
Put $bind_address in vhost config only if it's explicitly specified

Only add the 'ip' element to the $default_vhost_conf hash if it was explicitly
specified in the instantiation of the class.  This is because ip => undef gets
changed to ip => '' via the Puppet function API when ensure_resource is called.
For port => 80, that causes a conflict with the Apache module's default
port 80 vhost listener.

Change-Id: I504857aca99a7a3c42ee17242bcc0dea33f1b6e4
Closes-Bug: 1371345

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-12 14:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/constraints.py'], 'message': 'Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

An equivalent fix will be required for all projects which use
eventlet.wsgi.

Change-Id: I3fd1d24d51d38a188001dd4c9f0aa0135899531a
Related-Bug: #1190149
'}]
commit_message:
Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

An equivalent fix will be required for all projects which use
eventlet.wsgi.

Change-Id: I3fd1d24d51d38a188001dd4c9f0aa0135899531a
Related-Bug: #1190149

commit_message:
Correct error msg when resource or output are empty

When resource or output body is empty, we get traceback
instead of error message. This is wrong, so this patch
handle such situation by raising StackValidationFailed
exception. Furthermore, if output body is not a mapping,
we got traceback too.

Change-Id: I27f3a732480a851fd2eceb83e5fcc850ee59bb73
Closes-bug: #1386242

commit_message:
Move os_region_name param into glance::api

The os_region_name param is in glance::backend::cinder now, but this
is not appropriate, b/c we need to set os_region_name in multi regions
even we don't use cinder as glance backend.

Change-Id: I6f4841e29b87ae868484b1594fc0f8ddfb8c5122
Closes-Bug: #1369046

Avoids having to manually add protocols to check if it is a mapped
token. This check is done by using the identity_provider and protocol
fields in token, if they are present, means the token being analysed
is a mapped one.

Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>

Change-Id: I5a695fa2efa8da151158a15c3b7ec8885d57c2d1
Closes-Bug: 1390100
'}]
commit_message:
Adds dynamic checking for mapped tokens

Avoids having to manually add protocols to check if it is a mapped
token. This check is done by using the identity_provider and protocol
fields in token, if they are present, means the token being analysed
is a mapped one.

Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>

Change-Id: I5a695fa2efa8da151158a15c3b7ec8885d57c2d1
Closes-Bug: 1390100

Update cinder delete_volume description.

A delete volume operation will fail with a 400 error code if any snapshots
based on the specified volume exist.  Updating the api documentation to note this.

This is a nova change to pass the hostname on which the instance was started to
Quantum. The associated quantum plugins will pass this hostname to
hardware device vendors management stations to allow them to segment the network

commit_message:
Pass instance host-id to Quantum using port bindings extension.

This is a nova change to pass the hostname on which the instance was started to
Quantum. The associated quantum plugins will pass this hostname to
hardware device vendors management stations to allow them to segment the network
in a more precise manner (for example automatically trunk the vlan on the
physical switch port connected to the compute host on which the VM instance was
started).

Implements: blueprint vm-host-quantum

Change-Id: I05012ac7abf67a94b515361a7ef7ac1063cb0ac3

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-25 07:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/http.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_common_http.py'], 'message': 'Location no need to start with endpoint

When redirecting requests, it is possible that the redirecte is
between different host_addresses or schemes(http or  https).
The current code does not take this scenario into consideration.
An example: the endpoint is https://10.10.0.22:8004/XXX
while location (to be redirected to) is http://127.0.0.1:8004/XXX.

Change-Id: I67ab5b0fd2d5ef0a5d168354b2dc657d422ed532
Closes-Bug: #1385581
'}]
commit_message:
Location no need to start with endpoint

When redirecting requests, it is possible that the redirecte is
between different host_addresses or schemes(http or  https).
The current code does not take this scenario into consideration.
An example: the endpoint is https://10.10.0.22:8004/XXX
while location (to be redirected to) is http://127.0.0.1:8004/XXX.

Change-Id: I67ab5b0fd2d5ef0a5d168354b2dc657d422ed532
Closes-Bug: #1385581

128e042a2b68_ext_gw_mode.py for DB2 support.
This is because the add_column() of alembic does
not work for adding a non-nullable column with a
default value to an existing database table in DB2.

Change-Id: Idd9f82097871ef50e614dca3717751b736bb5832
Closes-Bug: #1328019

commit_message:
Change Neutron migration scripts for DB2 support

Makes some changes to Neutron migration script
128e042a2b68_ext_gw_mode.py for DB2 support.
This is because the add_column() of alembic does
not work for adding a non-nullable column with a
default value to an existing database table in DB2.
When we add full DB2 support for Alembic in the
future, we can avoid using this way.

Change-Id: Idd9f82097871ef50e614dca3717751b736bb5832
Closes-Bug: #1328019

commit_message:
Refactor module_schemas in policy engine Runtime

Previously, the schema for each module was stored
separately from theories.  A single theory could
define tables from any module.

This change is one of several that ensures
a theory and module are interchangeable terms.
All the tables defined for module M are defined
within theory M.   As such, the term 'module' has
been replaced with 'theory', and schemas are now
a feature of a theory.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: Ieee9dd9b90c4726bfea65c02a8dd0f9db59ba7e9

debug_cache_backend

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-10-11 05:22:00.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/resources/resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_heat_autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Remove unncecessary child_params parameter.

This patch removes the child_params passed from InstanceGroup and
ResourceGroup classes when doing create_with_template or
update_with_template.  The rationale behind this is that all subclasses
of StackResource are supposed to provide their own child_params() method
(or else NotImplementedError is thrown).  We don't need to pass the
params in method invocations any more.

A side effect introduced to the test cases is that we now have to
pretend the child_params() method is implemented by the faked parent
resource.  This is only to make the test cases happy.  When the reorg is
(mostly) done, some test cases must be rewritten.

Change-Id: I37211c4f0554698b9c15958b412bcceac5b06397
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unncecessary child_params parameter.

This patch removes the child_params passed from InstanceGroup and
ResourceGroup classes when doing create_with_template or
update_with_template.  The rationale behind this is that all subclasses
of StackResource are supposed to provide their own child_params() method
(or else NotImplementedError is thrown).  We don't need to pass the
params in method invocations any more.

A side effect introduced to the test cases is that we now have to
pretend the child_params() method is implemented by the faked parent
resource.  This is only to make the test cases happy.  When the reorg is
(mostly) done, some test cases must be rewritten.

Change-Id: I37211c4f0554698b9c15958b412bcceac5b06397
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code

commit_message:
Remove timeout from ResourceGroup method call.

This removes the unnecessary 'timeout_mins' parameter when invoking
either 'create_with_template' or 'update_with_template'.  The parent
class StackResource is already taking care of a 'timeout_mins' being
None.

This patch does not require a new test case.

Change-Id: I8d374f988cae6a7adad6c913236114ea11315280
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code

commit_message:
Remove _environment method from ASG.

This patch removes the _environment() method from InstanceGroup, or more
precisely, it merges the logic into child_params().  The intension is to
remove the necessity to pass child_params around.

Since this patch removes a method, a test-case is removed as well.

Change-Id: Ic4b34d11e4f00ce0240eea082e48675554943a00
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from FWaaS code

This patch removes the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from
the FWaaS code.  The equivalent direct usage of oslo.messaging APIs
are now used instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I1bab4dcd376d4e9684fee1edc97fd29a61ba38de

1) Install the keystone middleware package on proxy nodes to
   resolve dependency on standalone proxy nodes that don't
   run the keystone service.
2) Separate configuration for account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf, and object-server.conf files due

commit_message:
Fixed swift issues in installation guide

I fixed the following swift issues in the installation guide:

1) Install the keystone middleware package on proxy nodes to
   resolve dependency on standalone proxy nodes that don't
   run the keystone service.
2) Separate configuration for account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf, and object-server.conf files due
   due to unique port value for each service.

Change-Id: Ice5b5b6baa3488acc8b86f587c1efd728f034f8c
Closes-Bug: #1394025
Closes-Bug: #1394640
backport: juno

guide and common content to reduce install
guide build  warnings concerning overflow from about 22 to 16

backport: juno

commit_message:
mock out os.listdir to return a list

os.listdir returns a list of items.  The test case had been
written to return a single item which, though not really changing
the result of the test, was not the best approach.

This patch updates the test case to return a list instead of a single
item.

Change-Id: I793e0636440c0de0ca339c6592adec3e8b4ee1b4

Module @ https://pypi.python.org/pypi/wrapt

Projects that would like to use this to create a more
universal decorator method:

commit_message:
Add wrapt library

The wrapt library makes decorators much more useful than
with just regular decorators, especially in cases where
the decorator wants to know what object it is attached to.

Docs @ http://wrapt.readthedocs.org/
Module @ https://pypi.python.org/pypi/wrapt

Projects that would like to use this to create a more
universal decorator method:
 - TaskFlow
 - Rally
 - Others?

Change-Id: I26e78d34c2d12b5c9dbb520a09b618c579b84084
(cherry picked from commit e1ac9c1682d8a7d40a4a1ee5a28617a178de4dd8)

commit_message:
Implementing the use of _L’x’/i18n markers

Placing the _Lx markers back into the code.  No other cleaner solution has
has been implemented. Patches will be submitted in a series of sub
directories and in a fashion that is manageable.
This is the sixth commit of this kind

Partial-Bug: #1384312

Change-Id: I42b4e168deec9930571c1869fe1a181d4aad1112

commit_message:
Remove neutron ryu-plugin support

Ryu plugin was marked deprecated in Juno and will be removed for Kilo.

We (Ryu team) recommend users to migrate to ofagent, on which
we aim to concentrate our development resources by this deprecation.

Partial-Bug: #1391714

commit_message:
Add serial console feature to seamicro driver

Implements a console driver -- "ShellinaboxConsole" -- that uses
telnet+shellinabox to connect to serial console of physical servers
configured within the Seamicro Fabric Compute system.

SeaMicro System provides telnet facility to connect to any of
it's physical server's serial console. Port to which we telnet
depends on server-id.

Change-Id: I2e60f6402a984dbbb6e0f749729c5a7006310076
Implements: blueprint seamicro-serial-console

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-11-17 16:41:21.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': "Deleting failed replication backup can hide error

If there is a problem with getting the replication snapshot, the backup
is deleted. If the delete fails (if, for example, the backup is in the
wrong state) then the original exception is lost (and more importantly,
not logged).

Handling is now in place to trap exceptions while deleting a 'bad'
replication backup. All exceptions are logged and re-thrown as a
TroveError.

The duplicated code around the backup delete has also been collapsed
into one (nested) exception.

Change-Id: I858df7fd7eeb79dd1d559c4dd4b2851f7d0e0d98
Closes-Bug: #1386901
"}]
commit_message:
Deleting failed replication backup can hide error

If there is a problem with getting the replication snapshot, the backup
is deleted. If the delete fails (if, for example, the backup is in the
wrong state) then the original exception is lost (and more importantly,
not logged).

Handling is now in place to trap exceptions while deleting a 'bad'
replication backup. All exceptions are logged and re-thrown as a
TroveError.

The duplicated code around the backup delete has also been collapsed
into one (nested) exception.

Change-Id: I858df7fd7eeb79dd1d559c4dd4b2851f7d0e0d98
Closes-Bug: #1386901

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 17:13:15.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': 'Fix broken instance provisioning with disabled volume support

Reasons:
 - in certain deployments that has disabled volume support, different volume types
   (iSCSI instead of virtio) Trove doesn't inject trove-guestagent.conf, userdata,
   disables "config-drive"-based injection

Changes:
 - refactoring code to use one common function to prepare files and usedata
 - adding to Nova call:
   - config_drive parameter;
   - userdata

Change-Id: Icfa7d26a29c313e0d3f056dda389787ca3638506
Closes-Bug: #1394654
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken instance provisioning with disabled volume support

Reasons:
 - in certain deployments that has disabled volume support, different volume types
   (iSCSI instead of virtio) Trove doesn't inject trove-guestagent.conf, userdata,
   disables "config-drive"-based injection

Changes:
 - refactoring code to use one common function to prepare files and usedata
 - adding to Nova call:
   - config_drive parameter;
   - userdata

Change-Id: Icfa7d26a29c313e0d3f056dda389787ca3638506
Closes-Bug: #1394654

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-10-29 23:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_security_group.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Batch ports from security groups RPC handler

The security groups RPC handler calls get_port_from_device
individually for each device in a list it receives. Each
one of these results in a separate SQL query for the security
groups and port details. This becomes very inefficient as the
number of devices on a single node increases.

This patch adds logic to the RPC handler to see if the core
plugin has a method to lookup all of the device IDs at once.
If so, it uses that method, otherwise it continues as normal.

The ML2 plugin is modified to include the batch function, which
uses one SQL query regardless of the number of devices.

Closes-Bug: #1374556
Change-Id: I15d19c22e8c44577db190309b6636a3251a9c66a
'}]
commit_message:
Batch ports from security groups RPC handler

The security groups RPC handler calls get_port_from_device
individually for each device in a list it receives. Each
one of these results in a separate SQL query for the security
groups and port details. This becomes very inefficient as the
number of devices on a single node increases.

This patch adds logic to the RPC handler to see if the core
plugin has a method to lookup all of the device IDs at once.
If so, it uses that method, otherwise it continues as normal.

The ML2 plugin is modified to include the batch function, which
uses one SQL query regardless of the number of devices.

Closes-Bug: #1374556
Change-Id: I15d19c22e8c44577db190309b6636a3251a9c66a

commit_message:
VMWare:Avoid glance image download if already available.

While spawning, if the datastore chosen doesnot have the glance
base disk, the vmware driver downloads it from glance into _base
folder and creates a linked clone. A cluster can have multiple
datastores and it is quite possible that a previous spawn would
have already downloaded vmdk onto one of them.

This fix checks if glance image is already downloaded in any of
the cluster datastores and reuse it for creating linked clone.

This commit addresses second part of the blueprint.

Change-Id: Ic6c781154dbc2ff726cc21fd27e2839e396e7a23
Implements: blueprint storage-optimization-for-multi-datastore-clusters

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.config fixture

The fixture from oslo-incubator has moved to oslo.config,
we need to use this from now on. The copy of the fixture
in nova/openstack/common/* will be removed in a subsequent
review in this series.

Change-Id: I2d91db8c1535ca60f59f9d55c9d19de3e84dc40b

commit_message:
Nailgun documentation corrected.

Section 8.1.1 "Setting up Environment" was corrected
so that to ensure that Nailgun tests pass and
Nailgun starts in fake mode.

The change set include detailed descriprion on how to
downgrade to Python 2.6, how to install missing packages,
and minor corrections such as cd, workon, apt-get update

commit_message:
Revert wrapt usage until further notice

Currently its usage is failing on stable/icehouse
which is being fixed, but that branch is also currently
broken due to a tempest failure; so until this situation
is resolved take out the usage of wrapt.

Part of fixes for bug 1394647

Change-Id: Ibfe21944b6e6882f19f7cf4359e8356a64200278

commit_message:
Validate local_ip for OVS agent is actual ip address

tunnel_sync() writes this value into ovsdb and value is not validated. In
case non-ip value is written into ovsdb row must be deleted manually.

Change-Id: I57eee81e6821eb2cb26b3d07a39bc94b81243570
Closes-bug: #1284684

commit_message:
Make container_formats and disk_formats configurable

Since docker image format is not enabled by default in glance.
The cookbook should allow to configure docker image format in
glance api configuration file.

Implements: blueprint docker-configuration-support
Change-Id: I8ce16d3d4adb1c041edd4c6b603db16b7254a6c3

commit_message:
VMware add instance ephemeral disk support

After this patch, the VMware driver will support ephemeral
disks.

NOTE: This uses posixpath for manipulating
file paths for use on the ESXi host
(which always has posix style paths)

Related blueprint improve-vmware-disk-usage

DocImpact
Ephemeral disks will now work on VMware drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Shawn Hartsock <hartsock@acm.org>

Change-Id: Ic72c1ae7a6cb6b7c139acc68fbbdb5cfbf2b765f

subject: Fix Postgres support for Congress
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 13050, 'name': 'VMWare Congress CI', 'email': 'congressci@gmail.com', 'username': 'vmware-congress-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 01:39:31.000000000', 'files': ['congress/db/migration/alembic_migrations/policy_rules_init_opts.py', 'congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/db_policy_rules.py', 'congress/db/model_base.py'], 'message': "Fix Postgres support for Congress

This patch fixes the use of the deleted column for the PolicyRule.

Even though the 'deleted' attribute for the DB model is a literal,
the flag being passed around is a boolean. This causes a mismatch
between the conceptual model and the logical schema that may lead
to errors depending on the actual DB backend. For instance MySql
is fine, but Postgres is not.

Furthermore, soft deletes were also not represented correctly during
the initialization of the policy rule, as when a rule is soft deleted,
the deleted literal is a representation of the entity's uuid, rather
than a simple bool.

This patch also makes sure that from a DB schema migration, the
right defaults are captured.

Finally, the db module has been extended to allow the  retrieval
of soft deleted rules, as a future-proofing measure.

Closes-bug: #1394319

Change-Id: Ifce2506d95b68ef168d53f7f5977734f378c43df
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Postgres support for Congress

This patch fixes the use of the deleted column for the PolicyRule.

Even though the 'deleted' attribute for the DB model is a literal,
the flag being passed around is a boolean. This causes a mismatch
between the conceptual model and the logical schema that may lead
to errors depending on the actual DB backend. For instance MySql
is fine, but Postgres is not.

Furthermore, soft deletes were also not represented correctly during
the initialization of the policy rule, as when a rule is soft deleted,
the deleted literal is a representation of the entity's uuid, rather
than a simple bool.

This patch also makes sure that from a DB schema migration, the
right defaults are captured.

Finally, the db module has been extended to allow the  retrieval
of soft deleted rules, as a future-proofing measure.

Closes-bug: #1394319

Change-Id: Ifce2506d95b68ef168d53f7f5977734f378c43df

commit_message:
Convert hardware.VirtCPUTopology to nova object

All objects that have data that may eventually be serialized across the
wire in RPC comms, stored in a database, or potentially change their
schema, should be nova.objects. This patch changes the staticmethods on
the nova.virt.hardware.VirtCPUTopology class to a collection of private
(and one public) regular functions in nova.virt.hardware that consume and
produce nova.objects.virt_cpu_topology.VirtCPUTopology objects.

Change-Id: I2244aa7125b11568bc04d35e5de3eb2ee8c15167

commit_message:
Fix scheduling failure for disk_filter

For an instance booting from volume, the disk_filter should not check the
size of root_gb. And local_gb_used (reported from compute node) should not
be added to the instance's root_gb. This is because the instance didn't
use the local disk.

Change-Id: I806e33264b06df46eb27bd683001a65eb884a0ce
Closes-Bug: #1334974

commit_message:

To unwedge the gate on stable we need to temporarily remove the
icehouse jobs because a new ceilometer tests is failing at too high a
rate to let any unwedging fixes through. This should be reverted soon
after things are unwedged.

subject: Add safety check for cross-theory recursion
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1923, 'name': 'Mohammad Banikazemi', 'email': 'mbanikazemi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mb-s'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}, {'_account_id': 12875, 'name': 'Alexander Yip', 'email': 'ayip@vmware.com', 'username': 'ayip'}, {'_account_id': 13050, 'name': 'VMWare Congress CI', 'email': 'congressci@gmail.com', 'username': 'vmware-congress-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-21 00:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy/compile.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_runtime.py', 'congress/policy/utility.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_materialized.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_nonrecur.py', 'congress/policy/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Add safety check for cross-theory recursion

This sequence of changes allows people to create multiple policies
and then write rules that reference tables in different policies.
Previously, people could write rules that caused the datalog implementation
to enter an infinite loop by writing rules like a:p(x) :- b:p(x) and
b:p(x) :- a:p(x) (where each rule is in a different theory).

This change adds a safety check so that every time a rule is inserted
or deleted, that change is rejected if it would could cause an infinite
loop.  That check requires analyzing the combined dependency graph of
all of the policies.  Instead of re-computing the dependency graph
from scratch each time a rule is inserted into any policy, the
dependency graph of every theory is stored along with that theory
and updated every time the theory changes.

Unfortunately, the current implementation disallows recursion
even within a theory.  It is algorithmically non-obvious how
to appropriately relax this restriction.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: I7a4a5235f9c64d1b73bd09cfa4de12fdeecd629a
'}]
commit_message:
Add safety check for cross-theory recursion

This sequence of changes allows people to create multiple policies
and then write rules that reference tables in different policies.
Previously, people could write rules that caused the datalog implementation
to enter an infinite loop by writing rules like a:p(x) :- b:p(x) and
b:p(x) :- a:p(x) (where each rule is in a different theory).

This change adds a safety check so that every time a rule is inserted
or deleted, that change is rejected if it would could cause an infinite
loop.  That check requires analyzing the combined dependency graph of
all of the policies.  Instead of re-computing the dependency graph
from scratch each time a rule is inserted into any policy, the
dependency graph of every theory is stored along with that theory
and updated every time the theory changes.

Unfortunately, the current implementation disallows recursion
even within a theory.  It is algorithmically non-obvious how
to appropriately relax this restriction.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: I7a4a5235f9c64d1b73bd09cfa4de12fdeecd629a

Encapsulate Runtime's policy collections

Add functions like create_policy, delete_policy, etc.
so that we can expose them simply through the API and
encapsulate their implementation.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: I79121500ac04e78caa59d1e89e5f0c08421e8a21

commit_message:
Change network status cell values to Title case

All resources status values are presented as Title case except
networks's, appearing as Upper case.
I changed the network status values presentation to match
other resources, in order to maintain consistency.

Change-Id: I45e9dc18a8290745ae56dea82b5ccaff392822da
Closes-Bug: #1391482

subject: Make Runtime class aware of modules
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}, {'_account_id': 12875, 'name': 'Alexander Yip', 'email': 'ayip@vmware.com', 'username': 'ayip'}, {'_account_id': 13050, 'name': 'VMWare Congress CI', 'email': 'congressci@gmail.com', 'username': 'vmware-congress-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-21 00:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy/compile.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_runtime.py', 'congress/tests/helper.py', 'congress/datasources/tests/unit/test_nova_driver.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_compiler.py', 'congress/policy/dsepolicy.py', 'congress/policy/runtime.py'], 'message': "Make Runtime class aware of modules

Previously there was no way to reference tables in
one policy from another policy.  A table name such
as 'nova:servers' was treated as an opaque string
by the Runtime.  This made it impossible for
policies to share tables.

This change makes the Runtime class aware of the convention.
This way, users can create multiple policies that reference
tables defined in another policy, e.g. when all of the
policies want to share the data exported by datasources
(since those are stored within policies as well).

Note that caution must be used because cycles across
policies will cause an infinite loop.  A subsequent
change will include that safety check.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: I3547f857b3f73f752fa09911933474125ce07d84
"}]
commit_message:
Make Runtime class aware of modules

Previously there was no way to reference tables in
one policy from another policy.  A table name such
as 'nova:servers' was treated as an opaque string
by the Runtime.  This made it impossible for
policies to share tables.

This change makes the Runtime class aware of the convention.
This way, users can create multiple policies that reference
tables defined in another policy, e.g. when all of the
policies want to share the data exported by datasources
(since those are stored within policies as well).

Note that caution must be used because cycles across
policies will cause an infinite loop.  A subsequent
change will include that safety check.

Implements-blueprint: multiple-policies
Change-Id: I3547f857b3f73f752fa09911933474125ce07d84

commit_message:
Call http server package before calling http server service.

To start http server service we need to assure that package which
realize that service is installed.

Change-Id: I35d8015b82582b236e572b9ce92f5b52d34f6994
Closes-Bug: #1392799

commit_message:
Make notify_usage_exists() take an Instance object

This makes the notify_usage_exists() method for conductor take an
Instance object instead of a dict primitive.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I932c46e20f1d203f9587a39381563d58a10a3485

commit_message:
Configurable Virtio-scsi controller settings

Allow max_sectors and cmd_per_lun to be set on guests for the
virtio-scsi controller. This also introduces vHost-SCSI which can take
great advantage of these settings.

Change-Id: I8008dc0e21cc909fb8f08f85aa3e022cc0df5b98

This provides additional options to virtio-scsi for better performance.
This is done by exposing configurable options `cmd_per_lun`,

commit_message:
Add additional virtio-scsi support to Nova.

This provides additional options to virtio-scsi for better performance.
This is done by exposing configurable options `cmd_per_lun`,
`max_sectors` and `queues`. In addition a vHost target can be attached
to a guest with a given wwpn.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint virtio-scsi-settings

Change-Id: I55d7a4f94a5bc89e5b54949a16d87a3c8fc531c1

Changes to improve work under windows

Added check for procps in prepare-environment
Available memory check moved to separate action
Added requirements section in README
Fixed top and free check in Cygwin

Closes-Bug: #1373655
(cherry picked from commit 7c98912407dce20dbef759fb19719b79b4a627d2)

Change-Id: Id67ae55210b5896239960bb95e4b0f93d5b0ad49

commit_message:
Set metadata_host in nova.conf

Set metadata_host to SERVICE_HOST, ensuring nova-network routes
metadata requests to the correct server in a multi host setup.

commit_message:
Simplify code that serializes namedtuple in L2pop RPC

This change does not make any functional change therefore it will not
close any bug.  It cleans up a loose end that was left when bug
1352801 was closed.  However, it cannot be merged until Neutron's
oslo.messaging requirement is updated to include a fix for bug
1356173.

Change-Id: I0269808b73972c97cd18369b6aa3ec1d334f24f7
Related-Bug: #1352801
Related-Bug: #1356173

neutron-ofagent-agent currently relies on the fact the rootwrap
filters for neutron-openvswitch-agent covers what it needs.
as they are independent agents and their requirements are
getting more different, introduce a dedicated rootwrap filters
for ofagent.

Closes-Bug: #1392560
Change-Id: Iba205260a238431432caf8d9697268ceeef85eca'}]
commit_message:
Add rootwrap filters for ofagent

neutron-ofagent-agent currently relies on the fact the rootwrap
filters for neutron-openvswitch-agent covers what it needs.
as they are independent agents and their requirements are
getting more different, introduce a dedicated rootwrap filters
for ofagent.

Closes-Bug: #1392560
Change-Id: Iba205260a238431432caf8d9697268ceeef85eca

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-03 08:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Capture exception when delete a volume detached

Currently, the cinder api validate volume state before validating volume
attach status, so the VolumeAttached exception will never be raised. this
patch change the order of validation to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I41451f5f9d8e60b3cfc1a8004b704285fc3ddc2b
'}]
commit_message:
Capture exception when delete a volume detached

Currently, the cinder api validate volume state before validating volume
attach status, so the VolumeAttached exception will never be raised. this
patch change the order of validation to fix this issue.

Change-Id: I41451f5f9d8e60b3cfc1a8004b704285fc3ddc2b

commit_message:
NSX: Validate gateway device list against DB

This patch adds a check for validating the devices for a network
gateway are defined in the neutron DB before the request for
creating the network gateway is sent to the NSX backend.

Change-Id: Ic2245f965da332dbaee4ab5a869ce47f06a9e6ce
Partial-Bug: #1319581

commit_message:
Local development implementation for Certificates

A basic local filesystem implementation of CertManager and
a local pyOpenSSL implementation of CertGenerator.

Change-Id: I0eb0476afaad8a1bbb2eaaf90564eb63f7872546
Partially-implements: blueprint tls-data-security

commit_message:

Change it to return failed if start failed

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-11-19 16:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py', 'tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "rabbit: uses kombu instead of builtin stuffs

The rabbit driver have a custom code to reconnect to a broker,
to change the broker in HA configuration, to retry a to send
a message, to handle the interval between reconnection.

But all of that exists in kombu, so just use it.

Using the kombu Connection object with the url make also the rabbit
driver more generic.

Futher patches can rename rabbit* oslo.config options to a more generic
name and add a new driver entry_point 'kombu' to allow to use this driver
with any borker supported by kombu.

Change-Id: Id6b89d5448126ca652b46fe6ce5a9b3ed5839795
"}]
commit_message:
rabbit: uses kombu instead of builtin stuffs

The rabbit driver have a custom code to reconnect to a broker,
to change the broker in HA configuration, to retry a to send
a message, to handle the interval between reconnection.

But all of that exists in kombu, so just use it.

Using the kombu Connection object with the url make also the rabbit
driver more generic.

Futher patches can rename rabbit* oslo.config options to a more generic
name and add a new driver entry_point 'kombu' to allow to use this driver
with any borker supported by kombu.

Change-Id: Id6b89d5448126ca652b46fe6ce5a9b3ed5839795

subject: Add OpenStack Cinder support for IBM FlashSystem.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 12516, 'name': 'Edwin Wang', 'email': 'edwin.wang@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'edwin.wang'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-22 03:58:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/cinder-specs-ibm-flashsystem.rst'], 'message': "Add OpenStack Cinder support for IBM FlashSystem.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/ibm-flashsystem-driver

User Interface of IBM FlashSystem is based on SVC like IBM Storwize. But it's
a totally unlike storage backend and it's hard to rework the Storwize driver.
The functionality is completely different.
In the future, it is likely that the two systems will diverge in their
similarity.
The development felt it was best to create a separate driver.

Implements: blueprint ibm-flashsystem-driver
Change-Id: Ib78528ffedc9b40450e499b7f8aa94680733b3be
"}]
commit_message:
Add OpenStack Cinder support for IBM FlashSystem.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/ibm-flashsystem-driver

User Interface of IBM FlashSystem is based on SVC like IBM Storwize. But it's
a totally unlike storage backend and it's hard to rework the Storwize driver.
The functionality is completely different.
In the future, it is likely that the two systems will diverge in their
similarity.
The development felt it was best to create a separate driver.

Implements: blueprint ibm-flashsystem-driver
Change-Id: Ib78528ffedc9b40450e499b7f8aa94680733b3be

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-19 17:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Handle Galera deadlock on SELECT FOR UPDATE

Using nova-api in the wild shows that we've got an additional
exception, that must be treated like a deadlock, so that we
can handle this error properly and retry the transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1394298

Change-Id: If75f2b5984979fe55ad04ccec8713989307c56ae
"}]
commit_message:
Handle Galera deadlock on SELECT FOR UPDATE

Using nova-api in the wild shows that we've got an additional
exception, that must be treated like a deadlock, so that we
can handle this error properly and retry the transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1394298

Change-Id: If75f2b5984979fe55ad04ccec8713989307c56ae

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 00:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/standby.py'], 'message': 'Support configdrive from HTTP(S)

This commit adds support for passing an HTTP(S) URL as the
`configdrive` parameter for the `prepare_image` command.

This will load the entire image in memory. Although the configdrive
is limited to 64MB, this is not ideal and should be made better
in the future (likely when imaging gets refactored).

Change-Id: I6f14b9059920d2cef108c30d027c5486fa0b7e9a
Implements: blueprint expose-configdrive
'}]
commit_message:
Support configdrive from HTTP(S)

This commit adds support for passing an HTTP(S) URL as the
`configdrive` parameter for the `prepare_image` command.

This will load the entire image in memory. Although the configdrive
is limited to 64MB, this is not ideal and should be made better
in the future (likely when imaging gets refactored).

Change-Id: I6f14b9059920d2cef108c30d027c5486fa0b7e9a
Implements: blueprint expose-configdrive

subject: Add the ability to amplify metric payloads
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11094, 'name': 'Tim Kuhlman', 'email': 'timothy.kuhlman@canonical.com', 'username': 'kuhlmant'}, {'_account_id': 12108, 'name': 'Gary Hessler', 'email': 'gary.hessler@hp.com', 'username': 'garyh'}, {'_account_id': 12443, 'name': 'David Schroeder', 'email': 'openstack@a7n.net', 'username': 'dschroeder'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-20 21:40:50.000000000', 'files': ['agent.conf.template', 'monagent/common/config.py', 'monagent/forwarder/api/mon.py', 'monsetup/main.py'], 'message': "Add the ability to amplify metric payloads

It may be helpful, for load testing, for one node to be able to send
extra metrics, multiples of its typical payload.  One node could thus
impersonate two or three or ten in terms of the total number of metrics
submitted.

This patch adds this ability through use of an 'amplifier'
configuration option.  If set above zero, each measurement will be
duplicated, with an additional 'amplifier' dimension, making it a
unique metric.  The higher 'amplifier' configuration value is raised,
the more multiples of each metric will be submitted.

To configure, run monasca-setup with the --amplifier parameter, as in
'--amplifier 2' for two additional sets of metrics per API payload.

Change-Id: Ibc277bb31bca449510fc7bb6d5520b329a78aea4
"}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to amplify metric payloads

It may be helpful, for load testing, for one node to be able to send
extra metrics, multiples of its typical payload.  One node could thus
impersonate two or three or ten in terms of the total number of metrics
submitted.

This patch adds this ability through use of an 'amplifier'
configuration option.  If set above zero, each measurement will be
duplicated, with an additional 'amplifier' dimension, making it a
unique metric.  The higher 'amplifier' configuration value is raised,
the more multiples of each metric will be submitted.

To configure, run monasca-setup with the --amplifier parameter, as in
'--amplifier 2' for two additional sets of metrics per API payload.

Change-Id: Ibc277bb31bca449510fc7bb6d5520b329a78aea4

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2014-11-19 19:11:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/reports/test_views.py', 'openstack/common/report/models/base.py', 'openstack/common/report/models/with_default_views.py'], 'message': 'Report: Propagate view_type through collections

Previously, if a model contained a property with a
collection (sequence or mapping) of models, set_current_view_type
would not propagate the current_view_type to those models.

This change allows the set_current_view_type to descend recursively
throught not just models, but also arbitrary sequences and mappings
to set the view type.

Change-Id: I3701b7b33195038ccc6b57456bfd0e732c32bbda
'}]
commit_message:
Report: Propagate view_type through collections

Previously, if a model contained a property with a
collection (sequence or mapping) of models, set_current_view_type
would not propagate the current_view_type to those models.

This change allows the set_current_view_type to descend recursively
throught not just models, but also arbitrary sequences and mappings
to set the view type.

Change-Id: I3701b7b33195038ccc6b57456bfd0e732c32bbda

subject: Validate database migrations and model
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 16:08:00.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/validate-migrations-and-model.rst'], 'message': 'Validate database migrations and model

Database migrations and the database model are managed independently in
Nova. When a new database migration is added, changes are often needed
to the database model and vice versa. However, there are no tests or
checks that the database model matches the results of the database
migrations leaving them to often drift apart.

Change-Id: I3671faa62c22179addaf0f24f918eaffa7dbe30f
'}]
commit_message:
Validate database migrations and model

Database migrations and the database model are managed independently in
Nova. When a new database migration is added, changes are often needed
to the database model and vice versa. However, there are no tests or
checks that the database model matches the results of the database
migrations leaving them to often drift apart.

Change-Id: I3671faa62c22179addaf0f24f918eaffa7dbe30f

This test creates a swift container, puts something in it

commit_message:
Add scenario test for swift-proxy ceilometer middleware

This test creates a swift container, puts something in it
and then checks for samples stored by ceilometer which were
created by notifications from the middleware. test.call_until_true
is used to loop across multiple requests for samples in order
to be flexible in the face of latency on the notifications bus.

Change-Id: I07316db1f51d0562919ed2a50f002011944bfdb1

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2014-11-20 09:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_migration_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.conf'], 'message': 'Use opportunistic approach for migration testing

Refactored migration tests to use OpportunisticTestCase, removed
unused code, BaseMigrationTestCase class and ``test_migrations.conf`` file.

The main feature of this approach is to create a new database with
random name for each migration test. This will avoid migration tests of
race conditions and reduce tests intersection. After this change,
``openstack_citest`` user credentials will be used only for initial connection
to the database.  TestMigrationUtils class was refactored also, because
BaseMigrationTestCase was removed.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5c9aaa56e5041b919b1e96a19e0395c5e03b727a
'}]
commit_message:
Use opportunistic approach for migration testing

Refactored migration tests to use OpportunisticTestCase, removed
unused code, BaseMigrationTestCase class and ``test_migrations.conf`` file.

The main feature of this approach is to create a new database with
random name for each migration test. This will avoid migration tests of
race conditions and reduce tests intersection. After this change,
``openstack_citest`` user credentials will be used only for initial connection
to the database.  TestMigrationUtils class was refactored also, because
BaseMigrationTestCase was removed.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5c9aaa56e5041b919b1e96a19e0395c5e03b727a

commit_message:
Implementing Webhook Notification type

This patch enables the Webhook notification through a Http POST in a
URL address given in the "address" field of the Monasca
Notification-Method resource.

Depends on patch 135365

bp webhook-notification

Change-Id: Iec64d4507c360df1e123552d78ef9d97c5ba05d1

commit_message:
Adding support to WEBHOOK notification

This patch is the first step to make Monasca support
Webhook Notification, through a POST on a given address.
It will be followed by the monasca-notification implementation.

bp webhook-notification

Change-Id: I4a699a74651802546aec35a75ce7101e0e68db06

commit_message:
Add stable compat jobs to oslo libs in stable requirements

This commit plugs a testing gap which we've hit at least twice in the
last 2 days. Oslo libraries that are in stable branches of global
requirements uncapped can add changes which will break dsvm jobs on
the stable branches. This adds the stable compat checking to those
jobs to ensure we don't break the stable branches with new changes.

Change-Id: Ib0ebac021afadb9d829a2adaadbacf76aea5fe55

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-19 17:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nec/agent/nec_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ryu/agent/ryu_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ryu/test_ryu_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nec/test_nec_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/mlnx/test_rpcapi.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_agent_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_rpcapi.py', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/hyperv/test_hyperv_rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Drop RpcProxy usage from neutron.agent.rpc.PluginApi

This patch removes the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from
the neutron.agent.rpc.PluginApi class.  The equivalent use of
oslo.messaging APIs have been put in place instead.  This simple
conversion had a pretty wide impact on unit tests, as well.

The security groups API was converted in this patch as well.  It was
necessary because the security group class is used as a mixin, so it
must be implemented the same way.  Unfortunately, the way this is used
as a mix-in is not consistent, so for now it's only conditionally
converted.

Finally, some other miscellaneous plugin specific interfaces were
converted as well.  Again, these were methods mixed-in for certain
plugins.

Note that there's one very minor functional difference in this patch.
The previous code set the base version to be '1.1'.  The right pattern
is for this to be set to '1.0'.  This version is the default version
specified by the client, telling the server that it must implement at
least this version to satisfy the request.  The default should be
'1.0' and methods that require higher than that should specify it.
From looking at other parts of the code, '1.0' vs '1.1' is not
actually important, as '1.1' was actually the addition of some
security group methods defined elsewhere.  The correction is more
about establishing the right pattern to follow.

Change-Id: I391c01e79943ef179d815ea602253720925ccce1
"}]
commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from neutron.agent.rpc.PluginApi

This patch removes the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from
the neutron.agent.rpc.PluginApi class.  The equivalent use of
oslo.messaging APIs have been put in place instead.  This simple
conversion had a pretty wide impact on unit tests, as well.

The security groups API was converted in this patch as well.  It was
necessary because the security group class is used as a mixin, so it
must be implemented the same way.  Unfortunately, the way this is used
as a mix-in is not consistent, so for now it's only conditionally
converted.

Finally, some other miscellaneous plugin specific interfaces were
converted as well.  Again, these were methods mixed-in for certain
plugins.

Note that there's one very minor functional difference in this patch.
The previous code set the base version to be '1.1'.  The right pattern
is for this to be set to '1.0'.  This version is the default version
specified by the client, telling the server that it must implement at
least this version to satisfy the request.  The default should be
'1.0' and methods that require higher than that should specify it.
From looking at other parts of the code, '1.0' vs '1.1' is not
actually important, as '1.1' was actually the addition of some
security group methods defined elsewhere.  The correction is more
about establishing the right pattern to follow.

Change-Id: I391c01e79943ef179d815ea602253720925ccce1

Rather than waiting for each contributor to attempt to submit

hidden directory just to be rejected, let's just ignore hidden
files/dirs by default in the top-level neutron directory.

Change-Id: I145bec958a3db7423a4e820a310b138ed189d2cc
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore top-level hidden dirs/files by default

Rather than waiting for each contributor to attempt to submit
a change to .gitignore trying to add the $editor_of_the_week
hidden directory just to be rejected, let's just ignore hidden
files/dirs by default in the top-level neutron directory.

Change-Id: I145bec958a3db7423a4e820a310b138ed189d2cc

commit_message:
Refactor get_credentials out of DataSourceDriver class

This patch factors out the method get_credentials() out of the
DataSourceDriver class. In addition, removes the logic that allows
the tests to pass in a client() to a datasource to avoid mocking out the
client import. The motiviation for me to remove this is we can use mock
directly to do this without having to have additional code logic in a
datasource driver to test it.

Partially implements blueprint refactor-datasource-driver-framework

Change-Id: I7b07ff1fc34eff9aa28d310c8482edfdf9fb4e92

This patch removes the need for a datasource driver to implement the
method get_translators() as the base class keeps track of the translators
when they are registered.

Several methods in the base class had to become non-classmethods as they
now require use of self._transators which is a member variable which is
populated via register_translator().

This patch also corrects a few random schema bugs in the tests which are now
exposed.

Partially implements blueprint refactor-datasource-driver-framework

Change-Id: I0f8734353f99db09993593f1a1895055834e27e5
'}]
commit_message:
Implement get_translators in the base class

This patch removes the need for a datasource driver to implement the
method get_translators() as the base class keeps track of the translators
when they are registered.

Several methods in the base class had to become non-classmethods as they
now require use of self._transators which is a member variable which is
populated via register_translator().

This patch also corrects a few random schema bugs in the tests which are now
exposed.

Partially implements blueprint refactor-datasource-driver-framework

Change-Id: I0f8734353f99db09993593f1a1895055834e27e5

Previously the method convert_obj() had a lot of logic which would
verify that a translation table schema was valid. This code was run each time
update_from_datasources() was called and the check only really needed to be
done once since the translations tables do not dymanically change.

The validation of schema is now done once when a datasource driver calls
register_translator(translator). Having the datasource driver register the
schema solves the problem of tables not showing up for a datasource driver
unless it makes a full pass through update_from_datasources() which can take
a while depending on the speed of a datasource. Now the tables show up when
the driver loads.

In addition, previously there was a bug where multiple translators could
define the same table name and this would go undetected. Now we check
for this because we keep track of these tables in the DataSourceDriver class
direclty now.

Partially implements blueprint: refactor-datasource-driver-framework

Change-Id: Iacf9144cad7c60251c138d8651cf55e331f8fe53

commit_message:
Refactor datasource translator logic

Previously the method convert_obj() had a lot of logic which would
verify that a translation table schema was valid. This code was run each time
update_from_datasources() was called and the check only really needed to be
done once since the translations tables do not dymanically change.

The validation of schema is now done once when a datasource driver calls
register_translator(translator). Having the datasource driver register the
schema solves the problem of tables not showing up for a datasource driver
unless it makes a full pass through update_from_datasources() which can take
a while depending on the speed of a datasource. Now the tables show up when
the driver loads.

In addition, previously there was a bug where multiple translators could
define the same table name and this would go undetected. Now we check
for this because we keep track of these tables in the DataSourceDriver class
direclty now.

Closes-bug: 1393577

Partially implements blueprint: refactor-datasource-driver-framework

Change-Id: Iacf9144cad7c60251c138d8651cf55e331f8fe53

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-11-20 00:47:32.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': 'Move inline funtions out of convert_obj

This patch pulls the inline methods out of convert_obj to be private methods
in the DataSourceDriver in an attempt to improved readability. Inline functions
are generally dangerous to use if they are long, in addition one needs to
gernally take special care in variable scoping from the outter function which
can be error prone. This similar clean up should also be done in other places
but this patch just handles convert_obj for now.

Change-Id: I707cd5005400e4bb76e9adf57096db0da6f504e4
'}]
commit_message:
Move inline funtions out of convert_obj

This patch pulls the inline methods out of convert_obj to be private methods
in the DataSourceDriver in an attempt to improved readability. Inline functions
are generally dangerous to use if they are long, in addition one needs to
gernally take special care in variable scoping from the outter function which
can be error prone. This similar clean up should also be done in other places
but this patch just handles convert_obj for now.

Change-Id: I707cd5005400e4bb76e9adf57096db0da6f504e4

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-11-20 12:23:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_security_group.py', 'neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Check for default sec-group made case insensitive

Currently creating another security group with name
"default" is not allowed, however we can create
another security group with name "DEFAULT"
(or any other CASE pattern).

When trying to boot a VM without specifying
a security group it should always pick the
"default" security group. However, if another
security group of the name DEFAULT is present,
the VM gets associated with the wrong
security group (i.e DEFAULT and not default).

So, updated the code so that a security group
with name DEFAULT (or any other case pattern)
is not allowed.
Closes-Bug: #1384505

Change-Id: I3bc4e48cf723bcf74e098d7ef66df0333f6a8686
'}]
commit_message:
Check for default sec-group made case insensitive

Currently creating another security group with name
"default" is not allowed, however we can create
another security group with name "DEFAULT"
(or any other CASE pattern).

When trying to boot a VM without specifying
a security group it should always pick the
"default" security group. However, if another
security group of the name DEFAULT is present,
the VM gets associated with the wrong
security group (i.e DEFAULT and not default).

So, updated the code so that a security group
with name DEFAULT (or any other case pattern)
is not allowed.
Closes-Bug: #1384505

Change-Id: I3bc4e48cf723bcf74e098d7ef66df0333f6a8686

commit_message:
Cleanup multipath ISCSI connections when disconnecting volumes.

The cleanup code previously would leave behind multipath entries and
did not always logout of the ISCSI portal. This changes the code to
be more like Cinder’s brick multipath disconnection flow.

Closes-Bug: #1385798
Change-Id: I425956a0bf7a50aaa793c925755b1f4e8740a4af

Setup libvirt for ssh-based block migration

When enabled, this configure libvirt to allow live block migration
via SSH.  This assumes proper key authentication is in place.

Change-Id: I6a30743f756a2d459b205def1a0021c6b9a542ff

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-07 21:05:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'specs/kilo/containers-service.rst'], 'message': 'Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

Containers share many features in common with Nova instances. For the common
features, virt drivers for Nova can be used to surface basic instance
functionality. For features that go beyond what can be naturally fit within
a virt driver, we propose a new API service that allows for advanced features
to be added without conflating the worlds of instances and containers.

Change-Id: Ibcd8b09fcc4ca3aef27ee2aa41b986ed232e3d25
'}]
commit_message:
Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

Containers share many features in common with Nova instances. For the common
features, virt drivers for Nova can be used to surface basic instance
functionality. For features that go beyond what can be naturally fit within
a virt driver, we propose a new API service that allows for advanced features
to be added without conflating the worlds of instances and containers.

Change-Id: Ibcd8b09fcc4ca3aef27ee2aa41b986ed232e3d25

commit_message:
Add driver_validate()

vendor.driver_vendor_passthru() should be validated before called
on Ironic conductor, like vendor_passthru(). Add a new method
driver_validate() to support this.

Change-Id: Idff802cece01940b8ade34fa343f1bc8e76f1630
Closes-Bug: #1391580

This change will make the region and project "sticky" in that whatever is selected
will remain selected.  When users select other projects or login/logout the region will
stay what the user last selected, and users will try to be returned to the last used
project

Change-Id: I8b38ab2cb8b616ad6976aa8167b8209926054df4
Closes-Bug: 1357047
Closes-Bug: 1389401
'}]
commit_message:
Make region and project sticky

This change will make the region and project "sticky" in that whatever is selected
will remain selected.  When users select other projects or login/logout the region will
stay what the user last selected, and users will try to be returned to the last used
project

Change-Id: I8b38ab2cb8b616ad6976aa8167b8209926054df4
Closes-Bug: 1357047
Closes-Bug: 1389401

'}]
commit_message:
Big Switch: Send notification after port update

The Big Switch plugin was not sending port update
notifications for security group changes after the
port was updated. This patch corrects that behavior
by calling the port_update method on the RPC notifier
when necessary after a port update.

Closes-Bug: #1376527
Change-Id: Ic2fd872725c1da8e2dc394473b7feb407d21268f

commit_message:
Reduce log level for MongoDB

adding setParameter=logLevel=1 (or 2 for debug) will reduce
the level that MongoDB puts into logs. The default level is
too high and should be lowered.
Removed verbose logging option because it conflicts with this
parameter.
Forked commit b59a9cb11ddbc2260785a58440465fd8b30d7a11 from github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mongodb repository.

Change-Id: Ibd55af8d2ef57cd12b71c6e7df26526350b4870b
Closes-Bug: #1393400

This starts the nova-metadata-api service on the compute
nodes when nova-networking is leveraged. This it seems that
in the compute node with nova-networking the service doesn't
start, this patch starts it up and allows for the local machines
to access the metadata-api.
This also updates the test so it confirms that the correct
process starts.

Change-Id: I22e0173eab746d54ec50ab9231e75705874ee973
"}]
commit_message:
Updated to start metadata-api

This starts the nova-metadata-api service on the compute
nodes when nova-networking is leveraged. This it seems that
in the compute node with nova-networking the service doesn't
start, this patch starts it up and allows for the local machines
to access the metadata-api.
This also updates the test so it confirms that the correct
process starts.

Change-Id: I22e0173eab746d54ec50ab9231e75705874ee973

This allows the administrator of the cloud the ability to specify
the glance API version.  This is required for features such as
Copy on Write (CoW) as Glance's v1 API does not expose enough
information to allow Cinder to CoW the image.

Change-Id: I3ba80207c22916629d210a23aad94bd143d2b00e
Co-Authored-By: Craige McWhirter <craige.mcwhirter@anchor.com.au>
Closes-bug: #1390345
"}]
commit_message:
Add glance_api_version to cinder config

This allows the administrator of the cloud the ability to specify
the glance API version.  This is required for features such as
Copy on Write (CoW) as Glance's v1 API does not expose enough
information to allow Cinder to CoW the image.

Change-Id: I3ba80207c22916629d210a23aad94bd143d2b00e
Co-Authored-By: Craige McWhirter <craige.mcwhirter@anchor.com.au>
Closes-bug: #1390345

commit_message:
Import puppet-openstack-cloud to Stackforge

Move the module from Red Hat repository to Stackforge which
will be allow contributions by the OpenStack community. This patch
integrates the puppet module in all the OpenStack infra workflow.

Change-Id: I1ce8b0de6c92e552d915828f6e92812f6f6adc5a

commit_message:
Remove passwords reflection from a logging message

  Extend fuel_upgrade.config.Config class with sanitize() method.
  Sanitizer substitutes config data with mask based on keywords.

Change-Id: Ib78ddd69a8fb82475d9078daa8f53283dd5c688e
Closes-bug: 1387164

commit_message:
Remove passwords reflection from logging messages

  Implement custom Logger class for sanitizing dict(), list() and
  fuel_upgrade.config.Config() instances.
  Add sanitizer() function which substitutes config data with mask
  based on keywords.
  Refactor all logger calls to use the sanitizer.

Closes-Bug: 1387164
Change-Id: I810610aed59f7a6a904b1bcfe4d89b674aba96fc

commit_message:
Remove havana compat from nova.console.rpcapi

Since we only support upgrading from N-1 to N, there's no
need to keep around this older upgrade related code.

Change-Id: I663b77230cb0ca87c31a4dfd6cddaf10c588a000

Securitygroup API is enabled by default, and a dummy
firewall_driver is no longer needed. This patch

Closes-Bug: 1332104

commit_message:
Fix ML2 securitygroup API enable/disable

Securitygroup API is enabled by default, and a dummy
firewall_driver is no longer needed. This patch
rearranges content to make it clear which files are
edited on which servers, and fixes the use of the flag
values.

Change-Id: I7b2a6e646bbf02aa79b39f7f118a2ce0f6bb6a40
Closes-Bug: 1332104

commit_message:
Replacement `_` on `_LI` in all LOG.info - part 1

oslo.i18n uses different marker functions to separate the
translatable messages into different catalogs, which the translation
teams can prioritize translating. For details, please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#guidelines-for-use-in-openstack

There were not marker fuctions some places in directory network.
This commit makes changes:
* Add missing marker functions
* Use ',' instead of '%' while adding variables to log messages

Added a hacking rule for the log info about checking
translation for it.

Change-Id: I96766d723b01082339876ed94bbaa77783322b8c

commit_message:
Block migrate config drive

This patch enables migrating a config drive during block live
migration using libvirt.

The disk.config is moved during pre-live-migration. If it is a
read-only file then it's unaltered during live-migration. If not
it gets synced with that of the source by libvirt.

Partial-bug: #1246201

Change-Id: If76cedc19027515156e7d1c6949a2c16290c27a7

Now there's a 'None' task_state between 'SCHEDULING' &
'BLOCK_DEVICE_MAPPING'.

So if compute node is rebooted after that procession, all building VMs on
it will always stay in 'None' task_state.
And it's useless and not convenient for locating problems.

Therefore, we need to add one new task_state(like 'BUILD_STARTING') for
that period.

"}]
commit_message:
Add a new task_state after 'SCHEDULING'

Now there's a 'None' task_state between 'SCHEDULING' &
'BLOCK_DEVICE_MAPPING'.

So if compute node is rebooted after that procession, all building VMs on
it will always stay in 'None' task_state.
And it's useless and not convenient for locating problems.

Therefore, we need to add one new task_state(like 'BUILD_STARTING') for
that period.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I94bcb6616f539c683132d6031b746fd359defffa
Closes-Bug: #1334929

Currently, 'vcpus' field in 'nova hypervisor-stats' and vcpus
in horizon shows physical CPU number instead of vCPUs available

$ grep "cpu_allocation_ratio" /etc/nova/nova.conf
cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0

$ cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep processor |wc -l
8

$ nova hypervisor-stats | grep "vcpus "
| vcpus                | 8     |

It shows 8 for vcpus even though cpu_allocation_ratio is 16.0.
With this patches, nova client can get the right value that should
be '128' in the above case.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1202965

Change-Id: Id895ba4ffffde32e8619f146eca0461eeeb50724
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vcpus output in 'nova hypervisor-stats'

Currently, 'vcpus' field in 'nova hypervisor-stats' and vcpus
in horizon shows physical CPU number instead of vCPUs available
in the system that should do reflect 'cpu_allocation_ratio'.

$ grep "cpu_allocation_ratio" /etc/nova/nova.conf
cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0

$ cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep processor |wc -l
8

$ nova hypervisor-stats | grep "vcpus "
| vcpus                | 8     |

It shows 8 for vcpus even though cpu_allocation_ratio is 16.0.
With this patches, nova client can get the right value that should
be '128' in the above case.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1202965

Change-Id: Id895ba4ffffde32e8619f146eca0461eeeb50724

commit_message:
Delete correct LUN after live migration at source

* During live migration using bootable cinder volume, Correctly
  delete the source compute node LUN for the cinder volume
  during post_live_migration at the source compute node.
* Maintain a dict of original volume_id->target_lun in
  migrate_data during the live_migration to destroy the correct LUNs
  on the source compute node.

Change-Id: I1ee3e7eb945027ec05db9803aa50c37b5adfc08f
Closes-Bug: #1288039

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-05-29 12:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/scheduler/driver.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Don't include user_data in instance object by default

The user_data field can be up to 64K in size, and may include
sensitive data such as credentials that the user is passing to
the GuestOS.

User data is an opaque data blob as far as Nova is concerned,
and only needs to be retrieved when responding to metadata
queries or creating the config drive.

By making it a field that is only include in the instance when
explicitly requested we can avoid the overhead of including
passing it around in other situations, and of the data leaking

Closes-bug: #1317100
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include user_data in instance object by default

The user_data field can be up to 64K in size, and may include
sensitive data such as credentials that the user is passing to
the GuestOS.

User data is an opaque data blob as far as Nova is concerned,
and only needs to be retrieved when responding to metadata
queries or creating the config drive.

By making it a field that is only include in the instance when
explicitly requested we can avoid the overhead of including
passing it around in other situations, and of the data leaking
into log files.

Change-Id: I3cbca3d865da7168d9c34f4c1df3b284af88e786
Closes-bug: #1317100

commit_message:
Make neutron security group lookup consistent

When requesting to boot an instance the neutron client
find_resourceid_by_name_or_id is used for security groups.
However, when the scheduler actually boots the instance it attempts to
look up the security groups in a different (case-sensitive) manner.

This change makes the assigning of security groups use the same neutron
API for consistency.

Partial-Bug: #1286463
Change-Id: Id950887b5011e7df7b66c212d1b074e0e8ccb84f
